texts.es: Ada de 51 años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar casa propia , ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno está en un lugar accesible, apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, Ada es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, Ada  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ada, 51 years old, lives together with her family in her own home. She makes a living cultivating maize and beans. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years, and has a lot of valuable experience that allows her to always have the best harvests. The land is in an accessible location, suitable for farming and with fertile soil. 

Everything that she produces she trades all around the community, and already has many customers, so people know that everything she sells is of top quality and at affordable prices.  

Ada is a responsible woman and very hardworking. She is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which would allow her to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, tools, etc, and improve the land which is shown in the photo. Ada has good payment references, she assures that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, tools etc., and improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her children's bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish her walls and improve her home.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 69 años alños de edad, esta casado y tiene 6 hijos, desde muy pequeño se a dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos, oficio que aprendio de su padre, ademas de la siembra de granos tambien elabora muñecos de barro, actividad en la que se involucra su esposa y sus hijos,son una familia muy unida y que juntos van saliendo adelante y eso lo enorgullece.
 
el credito lo necesita para comprar insumos agricolas como fertilizantes, herbicidas, fungicidas y semilla de maiz. A Rafael le gusta ver libre de plagas sus plantas de maiz, por eso compra de todo este tipo de materiales porque su principal objetivo al cosechar producto de primera calidad.
Rafael tiene tres puntos de ventas de muñecos de barro, en diferentes municipios.
El sueño de él es tener otros puntos de venta no solo de muñecos de barro sino tambien de maiz.
texts.en:
Rafael is 69 years old. He is married and has 6 children. From the time he was very young, he dedicated himself to growing basic staple crops, a profession he learned from his father. In addition to growing grains, he also makes clay figurines. His wife and his children are also involved in this activity. They are a very united family, and they are getting ahead in life together, which is a source of pride for them.
 
He needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as tertilizers, herbicides, fungicides and corn seeds. Rafael likes to see his corn plants free of pests, and for this reason he buys all these types of materials, because his main goal is to harvest a top-quality crop.

Rafael has three sales outlets for the clay figurines, located in different towns. His dream is to have additional sales outlets, not only for clay figurines, but also for corn.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides and corn seeds.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala, 35, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For a long time, her husband has wanted to replace the body of his old rickshaw. Because of the condition of his rickshaw, he is unable to attract passengers to an ugly looking vehicle and generate any amount of income. 

Gazala's husband wants to buy the new body as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he has found it difficult to cover the cost. Therefore, Gazala has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This loan will help him continue his business. 

Gazala is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia, 39, is married and spending her life with her four children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking a loan out for her husband, who owns an embroidery shop. 

Her husband has been selling embroidery materials for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, thread, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive, but its turnover is very high. 

Due to the high cost of materials, he is facing a shortage and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband can fill the shortage of embroidery materials. He will buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colours.

Asia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colours

loans.name: Ana Eufimia

texts.es: Ana es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para el gastos familiares como pagar la alimentación, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Ana is a school teacher in the city of Paucartambo. She is very responsible, and for that reason she was invited to participate in the communal bank "Llapallanchis Llankasunchis". At this time, she is in need of a loan to cover household expenses, such as food. She appreciates and values ​​this loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to cover household expenses, such as food

loans.name: Dushyigikirane Cb Group

texts.en: Dushyigikirane Group, whose name means “support each other,” is a group led by Beatrice. She is married and has nine children, aged between two and twenty-one years. She says the group is comprised of different members, with different business types, but for them the first mission is to change their lives. Beatrice owns a store and has been selling much merchandise for the past nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, corn flour and corn flakes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, corn flour and corn flakes for sale.

loans.name: Hector Carlos

texts.es:
Hector es huérfano de padre, vive con su madre y su hermana pequeña en el distrito de Huaycan y todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cubrir las 3 horas de viaje que demora en ir de casa a su centro de estudios. 
El es un alumno muy aplicado y ya se encuentra cursando la mitad de su carrera, sin embargo su madre tiene problemas económicos para afrontar sola los gastos en casa y Hector tendría que abandonar sus estudios de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder financiarlos.
El esta próximo a realizar practicas pre-profesionales remuneradas si continua estudiando y con esto podría ayudar a su madre en solventar los gastos en su hogar.
El cree que la educación es la principal herramienta para poder crecer y salir adelante, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva con todo el apoyo que le brindan para culminar sus estudios y poder así conseguir un trabajo que le permita ayudar en casa y ser al mismo tiempo ejemplo a seguir para su pequeña hermana.
texts.en:
Hector lost his father, but he lives with his mother and his little sister in the district of Huaycan. He gets up very early every day to cover the 3-hour trip it takes him to get from home to his learning center. He is an exemplary student, his half way to his degree, but his mother his having a hard time covering his expenses, so Hector would have to leave school, without financial support from Kiva's lenders.
He is very close to beginning his paid apprenticeships, which will allow him to help his mother with home expenses.
He believes that education is the main tool in order to grow and thrive, so he is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for all the support they provide, so can finish school and get a job that will allow him to help his mom back home home and to also become a role model for his sister.

loans.use: to pay for his teachnical studies to become an industrial mechanic

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como venta de cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is 31 years old. She lives with her spouse and children in the Nueva Arica district, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers in the province of Chiclayo, part of the Lambayeque region along the northern coast of Peru.

She is in the business of raising young animals, such as pigs, and selling them. Her business is located in the rear part of her home. She has requested a loan for 1200 nuevos soles so that she can buy nutritionally balanced feed for fattening her pigs. This will help her earn greater income for her family.

loans.use: buy nutritious feed for fattening pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for planting and improving his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 23 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta  y trabajadora vive con su madre, su hermana y su abuelo. La cliente está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The client, age 23, has been a farmer for three years now. She plants beans and corn, and when her harvest is ready, she sells the produce in different markets near her home. From the sale of her harvest, she manages to meet her household expenses. She is a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman, and she lives with her mother, sister, and grandfather.

The client is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for her harvest, such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, and more, and so she can improve the land that is shown in the photograph.  She needs to do all of this because what she earns now is not enough to cover all these expenses. With the loan, she can earn a greater income and achieve greater economic stability for her family.

loans.use: buy farming supplies for planting and improving her land.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 33 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era un niño aproximadamente desde los siete años acompañaba a su padre a la milpa y el ponia mucha atencion en cada palabra que le decia, en las cantidades que utilizaba los herbicidas del sulfato y en que distancia iba a sembrar una planta de maiz de la otra.

El prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de abonos, herbicidas y para pagar la mano de obra.
El sueño de Carlos es mantener el ritmo de producción que tienen sus cosechas para ayudarle a su familia con los gastos.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 33, has been a farmer since he was just a child of seven. He would accompany his father to the corn field and listen to every word his father told him, whether about how much sulfate herbicide to use or how far apart to space corn plants from one another.

This loan will be used for buying fertilizer and herbicides and to pay for manual labor. Carlos' dream is to continue his harvest's productive patterns so that he can help his family cover their expenses.

loans.use: buy supplies and labor for farming

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, la clienta quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old. She owns a store selling staple foods, such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, among others. She's been in the business for a long time, which has allowed her to gain experience in sales and make great profits. She is located in a busy city and she has a large customer base. She is her customer's favorite because she has a large variety of products, and she always has what they need at affordable prices. She provides an excellent service. She would like to expand her business and make a new investment but she needs capital, so she reached out to 'INTEGRAL' for a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs , bread, drinks, etc.. She has great payment references, and she is confident she will be able to repay this loan and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs , bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been providing transport as a taxi driver for many years. 

He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family.  Her husband needs to maintain his taxi.  Due to insufficient financial means he is unable maintain his taxi. 

Therefore, Irum has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With this loan, Irum's husband will be able to afford the maintain his taxi and in turn hopes to earn more income. 

Irum plans to save some money to meet her family's needs in the future.

Irum is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en:
Sameena is a 47 year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
a 
She is requested a loan for her husband; he carries luggage from one place to another on a donkey cart.  He wants to use mule instead of a donkey because the mule can carry more goods.  The change will enable him to save time and increase his income.

Sameena has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a mule. 

Sameena wants to save the profit for future sudden needs and to educate their children.

She thanks to Kiva and to its filed partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a mule.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  She lives with her three children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband is the guardian of her family.  He has run a mobile shop business for many years. 

Shazia's husband wants to purchase mobile accessories for his business.  He has insufficient financial means to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan she will enable her husband to purchase mobile phone accessories and hopefully earn more income to help manage his business and household.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 30 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of four children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver.

For many days his rickshaw has not worked properly, and he is unable to generate any income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Samina is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair rickshaw.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 46 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol. Mauricio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Mauricio, age 46, is very responsible about his household obligations. He has always been someone who provides his family with the best. He currently lives with his family, comprised of his wife and their two children. He is hard-working, and always goes about his work with happiness and enthusiasm. He is a farmer, and his main crops are beans and corn. 

Mauricio wants to increase his sales, and that's why he came by the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan. The loan will let him buy supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and more. He hopes to be able to rely on the aid requested since he has no other source of income. This will let him continue to secure his household's daily bread with no limitations.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 25 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two school-age daughters. 

Her husband has run a clothes selling for four years.  He is responsible for feeding the entire family and manage the household. 

He needs to purchase clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient income he is unable to purchase the clothes. 

Therefore Asiya is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can assist her husband purchase clothes in bulk.  He also hopes to increase the size of his business and earn more profit with the help of this loan. 

Asiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Fakhara

texts.en:
Fakhara is 41 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of three children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver. 

From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and now he is unable to generate any income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.

Therefore, Fakhara has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's rickshaw.

Fakharais is so thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan's support.

loans.use: to repair husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is responsible mother of a daughter who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has driven a taxi for eight years. 

He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family.  Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because its current condition is not good. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs. 

Therefore, Nasira has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With this loan, Nasira's husband can afford to maintain his taxi.  Nasira also plans to saving some of the profit to meet her family's needs in future.

Nasira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is the age of 35, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a tire air filling shop, where he provides services to his clients in the form of vehicle tire air filling. He has been running this shop for the last seven years. He manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. 

He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His tire air filling shop is very famous in the town- that is the reason his business running well. 

For the last few days, his air filling machine is not working properly. So, he wants to buy a new vehicle tire air filling machine to continue his services smoothly. Therefore, Sakina has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new tire air filling machine. This will help him to continue his business. Sakina is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tire air filling machine

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 30 years old woman who in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two school-age sons. 

Her husband has run a garment shop for 15 years.  He is only responsible for feeding his family and managing their household. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient funds he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Shazia is applying for a Kiva group loan with another member from field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband. 

He hopes to increase the size of his business and earn more profit with the help of this loan. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 40 years old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings. 

However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Majeedan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Majeedan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for resale

loans.name: Manuel Ovidio

texts.es: Manuel de 33 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Manuel  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, insecticidas  entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y también mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía,  él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 33, is friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife and their two children. He works very hard on his own piece of land where he grows corn and beans. His produce is of very high quality, and when his harvest is ready, he takes it to sale at different markets near his home.

Manuel is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL so that he will have the money he needs to invest in agricultural supplies, such as fungicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, insecticides, and more. He will also use the money to improve the land shown in the photograph. He is eager to expand his sales, earn greater income, and provide his family with increased economic stability.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and improve his land.

loans.name: Edelma Del Rosario

texts.es: Edelma  es una persona esforzada, producto de su labor como docente y créditos obtenidos ha logrado levantar su vivienda, pero a un necesita mejorar algunos detalles, por lo que solicita crédito para comprar cemento, hierro, bloque y piedra cantera y así poder  Construir un porche. Con esto dará mejor presentación a su vivienda y mejorara la comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Edelma is a dedicated person, a product of her work as a teacher. From previous loans she has managed to build a home, but she needs to improve a few things. That's why she is requesting this loan to buy cement, steel, blocks, and quarried stone so that she can build a porch. With this, she improve her home's appearance and improve her family's comfort.

loans.use: build a porch onto her home.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano vive en la Ciudad de Ica. Tiene 5 hijos que son su orgullo y por quienes ha luchado arduamente.
Trabaja  desde hace 8 años como obrero de campo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Mariano es un hombre luchador y una persona muy amable. Todos los días sale de su casa muy temprano para poder trabajar y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva, porque con el apoyo brindado remodelará su casa y así brindará mayor comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano lives in the city of Ica. He has arduously strived for his five children, who are his pride. He has worked for eight years as a farm laborer to be able to provide for his family.

Mariano is a tenacious man and a very kind person. Every day, he leaves his house very early to be able to work and cover his household expenses.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support provided, he will remodel his house and provide his family with greater comfort and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to remodel his residence

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. He is responsible and fulfills the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to repair his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires many maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to repair his taxi. Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, which will provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nasreen also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en:
Robeena is 30 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a mother of four sons.  Her husband has been doing scrap recycling for 11 years.  He is responsible for managing their household.

Robeena's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to financial constraints cannot buy scrape in bulk.

Therefore, Robeena has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase scrap in bulk and earn more income.

Robeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their financial assistance.

loans.use: ito buy scrape in bulk for recycling purposes.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is the age of 45; she is a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works selling dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. 

He sells milk to different tea stalls each day. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning from the milk sales.  He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sale business. So, Seema requested a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business.

She thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her milk sale business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband’s income is too low, this is the reason she decided to start a small business at home. Rubina runs a small boutique at home where she sells garments at very reasonable rates. 

She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it, and then sells it at higher price in her community. The ladies in town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for garments has increased due to attractive designs and colors. Her husband pays all the household expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis, this is the reason she has requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. 

Rubina wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sewing garments and then reselling.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a mother of six children,  Her husband has recycled scrap for the pst 12 years.  He is responsible for managing their household. 

Saima's husband is not able to buy scrape in bulk.

Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan to enable her husband to purchase scrap material in bulk.  he expects to earn a profit.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to help husband buy scrap in bulk.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three daughters and two sons. 
 
She has been making embroidery with her hands at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains sick most of the time and unable to do a job. To support her children, and to meet household expenses, she started making embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides all the raw materials she needs to make the embroidery; and she completes her tasks with her daughters using wooden frames. 

Yasmeen wants to start buying her raw materials directly, and to sell her embroidered items herself in the market so she can make more profit. Therefore, Yasmeen has asked for a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and wooden frames, so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell, and make more income.
 
She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales. She wants to use a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wooden frames for embroidery.

loans.name: Romilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Romilia de 51 años de edad desde hace 5 años que se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios con que vende sus productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias ha logra salir adelante con su familia y con los gatos que se le presentan en su hogar, Romilia vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y asi continuar con la crianza para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Romilia, age 51, started in the business of raising, fattening, and selling chickens five years ago. She has a large customer base thanks to the good prices at which she sells her products. From her earnings, she has managed to get ahead alongside with her family as well as the cats that show up at her house. Romilia lives in her own home with her family. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens and continue raising them, thus providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase concentrate and vitamins.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de pollo verduras y fruta en un puesto de mercado, tiene una bodega donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa, age 42, lives with her daughter in the district of Lagunas, a tranquil community whose people are farmers, merchants, and ranchers, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She is in the business of selling chicken, vegetables, and fruits at a market stall. She also has a store where she sells a variety of necessary goods. She is requesting a loan of 4500 nuevos soles so that she can buy groceries to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: buy groceries to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Santa Barbara. El inicio trabajando como jornalero siempre en agricultura y hace dos años inicio sus propios cultivos de café y banano. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 4,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para dar asistencia a su finca de café y lograr sacar buena producción. Tiene como meta ampliar sus cultivos para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonel is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a village of the municipality of Santa Barbara. He started out working as a day laborer, always in agriculture, and two years ago he started his own crops of coffee and bananas. This activity is his source of income.

He has requested a loan for 4,000 lempiras (HNL) to buy fertilizers and soil amendments to support his coffee farm and enable him to achieve a good production. His goal is to expand his plantings to obtain a greater income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and soil amendments to support his coffee farm.

loans.name: Glenda Yaneth

texts.es: Glenda, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en la Masica, Atlántida. En busca de obtener ingresos para su familia se ha dedicado a elaborar tamales para vender, hace un año que realiza esta actividad en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar insumos como ser, hojas, carnes, condimentos, papas etc. Para elaborar y vender tamales. Con este préstamo va cumplir con un pedido grande de tamales. Su plan de seguir trabajando es para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Glenda, 32 years old, is married, has two children and lives in Masica, Atlántida. Looking to get income for her family, she has worked making tamales to sell. She began this work from her home a year ago. The loan that she asks for is for 5,000 lempiras to purchase supplies such as leaves, meat, condiments, potatoes, etc. to make and sell tamales. With this loan she will fill a large order of tamales. Her plan for continuing to work is to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as leaves, meat, condiments, potatoes, etc. to make and sell tamales.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 30-year-old married women. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a government employee.  She has started a clothing business. She wants to be able to support her family through her work. She buys a variety of clothes from different areas and sell them at a profitable price in the main market.
 
Now, she needs to purchase some more clothes to resell. However, due to a lack of funds she is not able to do this. Razia has therefore asked for a loan from Kiva and our partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more types of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rukhtaaj

texts.en:
Rukhtaaj, aged 37, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to buy new types of embroidery materials to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers, and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For this purpose his wife, Rukhtaaj is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband. He will buy an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. 

Rukhtaaj is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with this loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders, and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of embroidery accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, onions, fish, meat, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 47-year-old woman living with her son and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw which was not belonging to him. With the help of savings he tried to purchase a new auto rickshaw, but due to insufficient cash in hand, he failed to buy his new rickshaw. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount. Therefore, Shahnaz has requested a loan for her son so he can buy a new rickshaw and drive it happily. Shahnaz hopes that now her son will be able to generate a constant income. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw food for his food stall

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin de 35 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar sus siembras.  Marvin  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Marvin, age 35, lives with his family in their own home. He is in the business of farming, particularly growing corn and beans. He's been in the field for ten years, and his experience has been invaluable in allowing him to obtain better harvests. His land is located in an agricultural area, and he sells in all the neighboring areas. He has a large and stable customer base, thanks to his high quality, truly accessible prices, and unparalleled service.

He wants to invest in farming supplies, but he needs capital to do it, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for this loan. It will allow him to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide, fungicide, tools, and more. He will also be able to improve the land where he plants. Marvin has good payment references, and he is sure he will be able to pay off his debt on time, and at the same time be able to provide his family with what they deserve.

loans.use: buy planting supplies and improve his land.

loans.name: Josefa Darling

texts.es: Doña Josefa es una persona activa, es Jubilada, ayuda a su esposo en el Taller electromecánico que tiene, ambos aportan para los gastos del hogar,  con esfuerzos propios y créditos han sacado adelante su familia hoy sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes.  Doña Josefa Darlin dio inicio la construcción de un cuarto con el crédito anterior no logrando terminar, requiere mas financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción como  piedras canteras, hierro cemento, para lo cual  solicita crédito y así poder terminar el cuarto que destinaria para que su hija quien es medico en un futuro instale su consultorio.
texts.en: Josefa Darling is an active retiree. She helps her husband in his electromechanical shop. Both contribute to the household expenses.  Through their own hard work and loans, they managed to get their family ahead and today their children are grown up and independent.  Josefa began construction on a room with a previous loan, but wasn't able to finish. She requires additional financing to buy construction materials like quarried stone, steel, and cement. With the loan and these materials, she will be able to finish a room that will later be used by her daughter, who is a doctor, as a consulting office.

loans.use: buy construction materials to finish expanding a room in her home.

loans.name: Medecris

texts.en:
Medecris is a 24-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Medecris's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Medecris is taking out a 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor, in order to build a house for her family.

Medecris has been with NWTF since 2012 as she has tried to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Medecris would like to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio vive en el distrito de santiago, trabaja día día como chofer de colectivo, puede atender alrededor de 20 clientes al día y cree que le va bien en su empleo porque tiene mucho empeño en salir adelante, ya que es padre de familia y su pqueño tiene 10 años.

Julio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para poder cercar su vivienda y de esta manera poder tener mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en: Julio lives in Santiago and works during the day as a taxi driver. He serves around 20 customers per day and believes that he his success comes from his drive to get ahead which comes from being a father of a 10-year-old boy. Julio is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy building materials to build a fence around his house which will give him and his family more security.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar lives in Kapan town with her husband and parents-in-law. She has been working in a retail business for many years. Specifically, Tsovinar trades clothing from her house. She also works at a local souvenir shop as a seller (the photo was taken in her workplace). 

This requested loan is very important for Tsovinar to purchase a new stock of clothing and sell it to her customers. The loan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this hard working woman to expand her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Meet Daniel, a father of one who has been practicing mixed farming for the past eight years in Kisii, Kenya. His primary income sources are milk, tea and peanuts from his farm. 

Daniel likes the peanut business: "Peanuts grow well in our area and have a good market,” he stated. Lack of capital is his major challenge. Daniel tried to raise capital through different methods, but he kept coming up short. A friend recommended him to Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner exclusively dealing with smallholder farmers. 

Daniel is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He has attended numerous trainings on basic financial skills. He knows the importance of saving and leveraging a business to maximize profits. He is confident that he will fulfill his repayment obligation without fail. 

Your loan will help Daniel's family improve their quality of life and meet their basic expenses comfortably. In his own words, Daniel said, “It will enable us to buy a cow that will feed my family.”

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has four school-going children. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima operates a café business, preparing various foods and selling them to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a PHP 3,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosemarie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 62 años de edad, esta soltera, ella vive junto a un nieto en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de cerdos y venta de ropa. actualmente decidió por vender ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños y calzado para damas. El negocio lo realiza desde su casa y le esta yendo bien. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños y calzado para surtir y vender y así poder aumentar las ganancias. Su meta es sacar adelante a su nieto y mantener el negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 62 years old, single, and lives with a grandchild in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida. Previously, she worked raising pigs and selling clothing. At the moment, she decided to sell used clothing for women, men, and children, and shoes for women. She runs the business from her home and it is going well. She has asked for a third loan cycle for 15,000 lempiras to purchase used clothing for women, men and children, and shoes for stock and to sell, so she can increase her profits. Her goal is to help her grandchild get ahead and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for women, men and children, and shoes for stock and to sell

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
From the village of Shalauri, Ia is a 32-year-old married mother of a one-year-old infant. The region has a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps many inhabitants earn a living. Ia's family started a lemonade mini-factory, distributing their product to stores in nearby villages. However, the income isn't sufficient to cover all expenses and daily costs, so she has decided to expand her retail business. 

Ian is requesting financial assistance for the purchase of sunflower packing machinery and working capital to start sunflower distribution parallel to her lemonade business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Ia, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy sunflower packing machinery and start sunflower distribution

loans.name: Bernani

texts.es: Bernani tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos. Reside en  Santa Bárbara. Desde joven trabajaba la agricultura junto a su padre. Lleva 10 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café y banano.  Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras para fertilizar y limpiar sus cultivos y mejorar la producción. Su objetivo es trabajar en sus cultivos para obtener mejor ganancia.
texts.en: Bernani is 35 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife with whom he has 2 children. He lives in Santa Bárbara. Since he was young, he has worked in agriculture with his father. He has had his own crops of coffee and banana for 10 years. He sells this product in the local market of the region. He asks for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to fertilize and clean his crops and improve the production. His goal is to work on his crops and to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to clean his coffee and banana crops to have better production.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia decidió hace 3 años poner una pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, refrescos, agua, embutidos, pan, churros, huevos, azúcar, manteca etc.  Y para mantenerla surtida solicito un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras y comprar más productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, refrescos, azúcar etc.  Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Amelia, 53 years old, is a single mother and has two children with whom she lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. With the goal to get ahead with her family, she decided three years ago to set up a small store where she sells rice, beans, soft drinks, water, cold cuts, bread, churros, eggs, sugar, butter, etc. To keep it stocked, she asked for a loan of 6,000 lempiras to purchase more products such as butter, rice, beans, cold cuts, soft drinks, sugar, etc. Her goal is to grow her business in order to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as butter, rice, beans, cold cuts, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Mirian, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, ella, su esposo y dos de sus hijos vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace muchos años que se dedica a vender frutas como sandias, naranjas, manzanas, uvas, mangos, bananos etc., papas, ayotes, aguacates y otras verduras. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa dedicándole todo el tiempo necesario ya que es su fuente de ingresos familiar. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más frutas frescas de la temporada como manzanas, uvas, melones, bananos, sandias,aguacate y otros para vender. Su plan es seguir manteniendo su negocio y que crezca cada dia mas para un bienestar familiar
texts.en:
Mirian is 39 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the municipality of Puerto Cortés with her husband and two of her children. She has always made a living in trading goods. For many years Mirian has been selling fruit including watermelon, oranges, apples, grapes, mangoes, and bananas, potatoes, squash, and avocado, and vegetables. She carries out this work from her house, spending off of the time needed to do so since this is her family's income source. 

This is the third loan that she is requesting and it is for 15,000 lempiras. With the loan she will buy more fresh seasonal fruit like apples, grapes, melons, bananas, watermelon, avocado and others to sell. Her plan is to maintain her business and grow each day for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy more fresh seasonal fruit including apples, grapes, melons, bananas, watermelon, and avocado.

loans.name: Seferino

texts.es: Seferino, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea de Morazán, Yoro.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la producción de maíz y frijol y hace dos años cultiva café, también en su casa tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, que lo administra su esposa. El préstamo es por 20,000 lempiras y lo invertirá para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarle a su finca de café. Sus planes son seguir con el cultivo de café para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Seferino, age 41, is married and has four children. He lives in a village in Morazán, Yoro.  He used to be in the primary business of growing corn and beans, but two years ago he began to grow  coffee. He also has a small grocery store out of his home where he stocks basic necessities, which his wife runs.  The loan is for 20,000 lempiras, which he will invest in buying fertilizers to apply to his coffee farm. He plans to continue growing coffee so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has a business selling milk with the support of her husband. She has two buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to people locally. She also makes and sells butter and cheese to make extra profit. 

Razia has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and she has now asked for a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). This will allow her to buy one more cow. 

Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family's income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years.  He sews leather and rexine shoes through a machine, and after that attaches the soles through stitching with his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home, and now he wants to increase his business on a wider level. But he does not have the amount needed to buy initial raw materials for making shoes. Therefore, Safia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the necessary materials. This will help him to continue his business. Safia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe making.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Amina has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo and feed for the cattle that she already has. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for cattle.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 56-year-old married woman living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, and he has sold fresh fruit at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruit to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of his fruit. Therefore, Hameedan has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 33-year-old lady. She enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She has two daughters and two sons. 

Her husband is not in good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, health and education. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. 

In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia, age 46, is a married woman. She has four children. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей живет в с. Водяное. Он занимается выращиванием овощей, а именно помидор и огурцов, на собственном участке земли. Имеет 5 больших отапливаемых теплиц. Более того, у него есть еще неподалеку один участок — там 2 теплицы без отопления. В свое время Сергей работал в Энергодаре в пожарной службе. Потом он начал развивать свой бизнес, времени стало не хватать на все и он ушел с основной работы пожарника. Сейчас огород — основной источник дохода для Сергея и его семьи. 
Сергею необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена для посадки второго урожая помидор. В планах Сергея — расширять бизнес, строить дополнительные теплицы, усовершенствовать систему отопления на главном рабочем участке и провести отопление на втором участке земли. У Сергея — хорошее хозяйство, красивый дом, везде порядок. Заметно желание трудиться, добиваться успеха своим трудом.
texts.en:
Sergei lives in the Vodyanoye village. He grows vegetables, in particular tomatoes and cucumbers, on his own land plot. He has five heated greenhouses. In addition, he has another land plot nearby, with two unheated greenhouses. In the past Sergei used to work in the fire safety department of the town of Enerhodar.  Then he started to gradually develop his own business. There was not enough time to do everything, and he left his firefighter's job. At present the vegetable garden is the main source of income for Sergei and his family.

Sergei needs a sum of 10,000 UAH in order to buy seeds for a second planting of tomatoes. His plans include expanding his business, building additional greenhouses, improving the heating system on his main land plot and install heating at his secondary land plot. Sergei has a well-managed farm and a nice house; he keeps everything in good shape. It is evident that he is dedicated to his work and wants to be successful in it.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina tiene 32 años, es comerciante hace mas de 4 años, vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Está en pareja con el Sr. Silvino hace 14 años, comenta que son una familia muy trabajadora, se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante. Ella se queda en el negocio a atender en un pequeño negocio de ventas que tiene  y su esposo trabaja como vendedor en una empresa y viaja mucho.
Justina comenta que su mayor deseo desde siempre fue habilitar un taller de costura ya que ella es técnica de costura y le encanta ese trabajo, dice que con este préstamo quiere empezar a comprar su primera máquina y así poder ir formando de a poco su taller.
Esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Justina is 32 years old and has worked as a trader for over 4 years. She lives in Coronel Oviedo. She has been with her partner Silvino for 14 years and says that they are a very hard-working family and help each other to get ahead in life. Justina runs a small trading business while her husband works as a salesperson for a company and travels a lot. Justina says that her greatest wish has always been to start a small tailor's shop because she trained as a dressmaker and really enjoys this type of work. She says that she will use the loan to buy her first sewing machine so that she can begin equipping her workshop. She is very grateful for the opportunity and believes that it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramon es de la ciudad de Pilar, es propietario de una despensa, se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 1 año. Comenta que tanto él como su esposa se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buenas referencias, comenta que es por su familia que él se está esforzando mucho, más aun por su hija, ya que quiere darle todo lo que no pudo, y así tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, bebidas, lácteos y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Ramon is from the city of Pilar and owns a grocery store. He has been running the store for over a year now. He says that he and his wife support each other to be able to get ahead. He is a very hard-working person, even more so because he has a daughter and wants to be able to give her everything that he could not have and to be able to have a better lifestyle. He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, drinks, dairy products and other products so that he can continue working as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, drinks. dairy products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store and to grow her business.

loans.name: Carlos Marino

texts.es:
Carlos vive en el distrito de santiago, trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Carlos esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en la habitación en la cual vive, ya que presenta algunas rajaduras, mejorar el techo, entre otros; asi podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle a su familia una vida mejor”.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the district of Santiago, and he works as a field laborer on a farm in his city. The income he earns from this helps him to get ahead.

Carlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they provide, he'll be able to buy the materials he needs to make improvements to his home.  There have been a few cracks, and he needs to improve the roof, among other things. This will help him achieve a better standard of living and keeps him fighting towards his big dream of providing his family with a better life.

loans.use: buy materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge vive en la Ciudad de Parcona junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Desde hace un año y medio este joven emprendedor trabaja con su mototaxi transportando a las personas de un lugar a otro para poder llevar el pan de cada día.
Su mayor motivación es su familia es por eso que este joven emprendedor trabaja desde muy temprano para ofrecer mayores comodidades a su esposa e hijo.

Gracias al apoyo recibido por parte de los  prestamistas de Kiva,  Jorge podrá cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “La construcción de su casita de adobe”, con eso estará mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar.
“Gracias Kiva”.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Parcona with his wife and his son. For a year and a half, this young entrepreneur has worked with his motortaxi, transporting people from one place to another to earn his daily bread. His greatest motivation is his family. They're why this young entrepreneur starts work so early - just to provide his wife and son with greater comfort. 

Thanks to the support received from Kiva lenders, Jorge will be able to complete one his greatest dreams, the construction of a little home made from adobe. This home will help him improve his quality of life.  "Thank you, Kiva."

loans.use: build a home from adobe.

loans.name: Aysheh

texts.en:
Aysheh is a 31-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarem city. She lives with her husband and three kids: a son and two daughters. Three years ago, Aysheh started her own beauty salon business. She uses a small room in her house. Aysheh gained good experience from her previous job.
 
Aysheh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new beauty products and makeup that she uses in her job. By taking this loan, Aysheh will be able to improve her business. 

Aysheh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new beauty products and makeup for her job

loans.name: Oynisso

texts.ru: Ойниссо женщина с прекрасными мыслями и доброй душой. Она работает и живет в северном Таджикистане. Ойниссо имеет одного сына. Ее муж в 1999 году уехал в Россию и без вести пропал. Ойниссо одна воспитывала сына. Его сын вырос и данное время свою семью. Ойниссо старается, чтобы ее семья жила в достатке. Она занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Ойниссо торгует на местном рынке. Этот бизнес она развевает уже более 7 лет. Ойниссо должна провести церемонию обрезания своего внука, но не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Oynisso is a thoughtful and kind-hearted woman. She lives and works in northern Tajikistan. Oynisso has one son. Her husband left for Russia in 1999 and has been missing since then. Oynisso brought up her son by herself. Now her son is grown and [has] his own family. Oynisso tries to provide a good quality of life for her family. She buys and resells dried fruits. Oynisso sells at the local market. She has been in this business for over seven years. Oynisso has to arrange for her grandson's circumcision ceremony, but lacks the necessary funds. She is requesting a loan of 1500 TJS for this purpose. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to organize the circumcision ceremony of her grandson.

loans.name: Ma. Pisan

texts.en:
Ma. Pisan is 37 years old and married, with four children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Pisan works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Pisan runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, laundry soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Ma. Pisan has been in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of items of that sort. 

In the future, Ma. Pisan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Venrie

texts.en:
Venrie is 27 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. With the child currently in school, Venrie works very hard to provide for them.

Venrie's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Venrie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Venrie has taken a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Venrie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Norma has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years now.

Wilma requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es: Luz Edilma es una mujer que le ha tocado reponerse de un duro golpe ya que por circunstancias de la vida perdió su marido y le toco desarrollar un método para generar ingresos que puedan mantener su núcleo familiar, decidió comenzar a ofrecer productos alimenticios típicos de la región como tamales, bandeja paisa y loncheras actividad que realiza por pedidos y que gracias al buen sabor de sus platos ha tenido muy buena acogida. Su mayor problema es la falta de un molino el cual le permita agilizar el proceso y que por su carencia ha tenido que decirle no a grandes pedidos, solicita un crédito para la compra del molino y comprar insumos en grandes cantidades que le salen mucho más favorable y le generan una mayor ganancia, con un gran sueño y es que su negocio genere más utilidades y pueda seguir manteniendo a su familia brindándoles toco lo que este a su alcance
texts.en:
Luz Edilma is a woman who has needed to recover from a hard hit, as due to life circumstances she lost her husband and she needed to develop a method to generate income that can support her family. She decided to begin offering healthy typical products from her region, such as tamales, bandeja paisa (a typical dish) and lunches, an activity that she carries out by request and that thanks to the good flavor of her dishes she has had very good reception. Her biggest problem is the lack of a mill which will allow her to speed up the process, and due to its shortage she has had to say no to large requests. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of the mill and to buy ingredients in large quantities that come out much more favorably for her, and will generate a larger profit. She has a big dream and it is that her business generate more profits and that she will be able to continue supporting her family, bringing them everything she can afford.

loans.use: to buy a mill to be able to accelerate her process and to buy supplies in large quantities for the preparation of tamales.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman with one child who goes to school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Eunice has operated fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a hairdresser living in Kapan town. She lives with her parents and brother. Her parents are retired and unemployed. The only workers of the family are Marine and her brother. He is a constructor and is privately employed. Marine herself is a hairdresser. She provides hairdressing service from her house. Marine also trades with different types of cosmetic products to her clients. 

Now Marine has requested this loan to be able to finance the construction of her own beauty salon. Marine needs this loan to be able to purchase cosmetic goods, furniture, and working materials for beauty salon. The loan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic goods, furniture, and working materials for beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad, age 33, is a married woman. She has five children.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Arshad needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is on her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pig's feet for her business.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for six years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 through Kashf Foundation. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 48-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for the past four years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality.
