She has three daughters and one son; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 45-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. She has three children. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, grains, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, grains, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 30 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband (also shown in the photo) for three years. She has two buffaloes in milk; she performs the task of collecting milk from them. Her husband sells it to many places on a daily basis on his motorbike. 

They have three children and so they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, Najma requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in their income through their larger sales.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer emprendedora que vive en la Ciudad de Tinguiña junto a su esposo y sus hijas. 
Ella hace algún tiempo trabaja en la venta de productos de Belleza para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Todas sus clientas se encuentran muy agradecidas con Vilma por los consejos de belleza brindados y porque es una persona muy amable
Sin duda es una mujer ejemplar que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijas y brindarles un mejor nivel de vida.
Es por ello que no le importa salir desde temprano a trabajar y regresar en las tardes para ayudar a sus hijas con las tareas del colegio.
Vilma estará eternamente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva, ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su hogar y más adelante abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en: Vilma is an enterprising woman who lives with her husband and their daughters in the city of Tinguiña. For some time now, she's been in the business of selling beauty products so that she can help with the household expenses. All her customers are very pleased with Vilma for the beauty advice she provides and because she's such a friendly person. She is undoubtedly an exemplary woman who wants to get her daughters ahead and provide them with a better standard of living. They are why she doesn't mind getting up early to work, then coming back in the afternoons to help her daughters with their schoolwork.  Vilma is eternally grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a refrigerator for her home, and later on, open her own business.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El  señor Feliciano,   es casado, vive en la ciudad de Santaní, tiene un hijo, quien es el motivo de lucha de él, ya que quiere darle todo lo que no pudo tener.
Feliciano es propietario de un taller de motocicletas, con varios años de trabajo, le ayuda su hijo, que también tiene equipos de lavadero, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan.
Feliciano pide este préstamo para la compra de repuestos varios para motocicletas y también para comprar algunos insumos para el lavadero que tiene en su taller. Está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Feliciano is married and lives in the city of Santaní. He has one son who motivates him since he wants to be able to give his son everything that he could not have. Feliciano owns a motorcycle workshop and has been working in this business for several years. His son helps him out in the workshop and he helps out his son who runs a car wash there. Feliciano is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles and also to buy some supplies for the car wash that he has in the workshop. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is receiving which will allow him to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles and supplies for his car wash.

loans.name: Elizabeth Magalli

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive en el distrito de santiago, trabaja como obrera en un fundo de la ciudad donde vive lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es  madre de 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años.

Elizabet esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en el cuarto donde vive con sus hijos, ya que no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y poder seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Que sus hijos vivan de manera digna”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the district of Santiago. She works as a laborer on a farm in the city where she lives. Her earnings allow her to get her family ahead, as she is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 2.

Elizabeth is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they provide, she will be able to buy the materials she needs to carry out improvements on the room where her children live, which is currently in poor condition. This way, she'll be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and she can keep working towards making her biggest dream a reality: seeing her children live with dignity.

loans.use: improve her children's room

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 47-years-old and has two children. Diosa is married and has one child who is still in school.

Diosa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Diosa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Diosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Julius. He is a hardworking mixed farmer based in Kisii, which is a small rural town in Kenya. He has a lovely wife and they have been blessed with a child. He has been practicing farming for 13 years.  His primary income sources are eggs, tea and vegetation produced on his farm. He also engages in personal businesses to make extra money.

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He enjoys very much taking care of animals. His hobby is milking early in the morning and late in the evening. He chops fodder in between the day and fills water in troughs for the cows to drink. He regularly inspects his animals to ensure they are healthy and the milk quality is great. 

Julius finds farming enjoyable, lucrative and full of growth opportunities. However, his biggest challenge is the poor roads leading to the market. This makes it expensive and time consuming to ferry farm produce.

With your loan, Julius seeks to improve his family's living standard. He fully understands the loan obligations and is committed to paying his debts fully.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato por lo económico ya no pudo seguir la universidad.- Esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a vender pan en la mañana y por la tarde, no tienen hijos y la madre de Ana vive con ellos.

Ana desde hace siete años trabaja en una escuela de oficios varios y comenta que cuando no llega la maestra de kinder tiene que atender a los niños.  Antes de encontrar este trabajo se dedicaba a los estudios y a los  oficios del hogar.  Junto a su compañero de vida se han dedicado ha engordar cerdos y sueña con tener una porqueriza grande.- Ella se levanta a las 4:30 am para prepararle el desayuno a su compañero de vida, pues él madruga a vender pan. Ella para llegar donde trabaja tiene que caminar unos 40 minutos, luego trabaja 7 horas y regresa a casa para atender su hogar y granja.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar 3 cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, ya que hoy vive en casa de su madre, construir una porqueriza y tener unos 3 cerdos y  pagar el crédito para tener puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. She finished secondary school but was unable to continue to university for financial reasons. She is married and her husband earns his living selling bread in the morning and afternoon. They don't have any children and Ana's mother lives with them.

For seven years, Ana has worked at a school, performing a variety of duties; she comments that when the kindergarten teacher is not there, she tends to the children. Before finding this job, she spent her time studying and taking care of the household duties. 

Ana and her life partner have raised pigs and they dream of having a large pig pen. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. to prepare her husband's breakfast, as he gets up at dawn to sell bread. To arrive at her place of work, she walks 40 minutes. Then she works seven hours and comes back home to tend to her home and farm. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of three pigs and concentrated feed to fatten them. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to build her own house (she currently lives in her mother's house), to build a pig pen and have about three pigs, and to pay off her loan to keep the door open for other possibilities.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and concentrated feed to fatten them

loans.name: Imelder

texts.en:
Imelder is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with three school-going children.

Imelder has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Bakyara Tuhirirwe Group

texts.en:
The Bakyara Tuhirirwe Group is an old group located in Cell One, Parkward, Ntungamo municipality, Ntungamo district. The group is comprised of men and women whose major activity is retail business and a few are engaged in agriculture. They applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. They will divide this money among themselves. They have the challenge of limited stock in their retail businesses due to limited income. Their prime target is to expand their businesses, have more stock in their businesses and take their children to better schools in the country. But they are limited by capital and funds to enable them to achieve their dreams. 

Nuriat will use her loan to buy more stock of household use items like salt, cooking fat, tomatoes and other items to sell in her roadside vending stall.

loans.use: To buy more salt, cooking fat, tomatoes and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beverages such as beer, stout and gin

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 42-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of scrap. She has been running this business for the past six years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She buys pet bottles and tins of pepsi, coke, mirinda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) or other similar bottles in scrap. After proper crushing and recycling these bottles she sells them to the people of her community. Through her business she makes enough of an amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has four children, all of whom are school going and she hardly manages to satisfy their needs. She is liable to provide them with good food, health and education so she requires earning more income to support her family well. She is in her ninth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more bottles and tins in different sizes to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles and tins in different sizes.

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is a 25-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.  Her husband is a turner by profession, he works over a lathe machine.  He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of vehicle engines, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and till this time his business has been settled. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have torn off and urgently needs to be replaced. Without the replacement of the effected parts, it highly effects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools.  Therefore, Shahzadi has requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy spare parts for his lathe machine. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to help her husband buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and cutting tools.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and married with two children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Virginia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Virginia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 26-years-old and married with one child who is in school.  Nerissa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Nerissa has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Erlinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,735 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Erlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florita is 42-years-old and has one child who is in school.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Florita requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell to restart her business activities.

Florita has been in this business for one year and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Florita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that has enabled her to take care of her personal and household expenses.

Besides the clothes selling business, Luvuno operates a retail shop. She is requesting for a loan to purchase household consumables such as soap, wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, and sugar for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase household consumables such as soap, wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kimya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chantal est une commerçante depuis 25 ans, présidente et membré de la banque communautaire «Kimya», senior entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 44 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 1 sac estimé à 900 poissons. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari son conjoint est un agent dans une organisation non gouvernementale. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en: Our client Chantal has been a vendor for 25 years. She is a member and the leader of the Kimya community bank. She is an experienced and energetic entrepreneur, 44 years old. She is a widow and the mother of eight children, all of whom are in school. She sells salted fish. She sets up her merchandise at the central market of her town.  Chantal is seeking a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She will buy a bag estimated to hold about 900 fish. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband, who works for a non-governmental organization. In the future, she would like to bolster her capital, build a house and provide for the education and food for her children. She thanks Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy a bag with about 900 fish.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 40 and the mother of eight children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories. He hires laborers for molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs a different category and quality of raw material. This time he has taken a larger contract than earlier but does not have enough cash on hand to buy an additional molding machine and the crushed plastic raw material to continue his manufacturing.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine.

She has to look after a huge family. She has to take care of each of her kids, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she has need of a huge income and her husband is the only person who is responsible to bear the household expenses.

She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 45-year-old hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to resale

loans.name: Asmagul

texts.ru:
Асмагул является искусной продавщицей из города Душанбе, ей 44 года. Она одна воспитывает детей. У нее 13-летний сын и 18-летняя дочь. Сын учится в школе, а дочь закончила его в прошлом году. 
Асмагул 7 лет назад начала свой маленький торговый бизнес. Она на рынке торгует овощами. Дети тоже помогают матери, так как это единственный источник дохода семьи.  Асмагул сейчас нуждается в кредите. Ей необходимо закупить новый товар, а также провести требуемый ремонт в доме.  Для этой цели у нее не хватает собственных средств и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом.  
В будущем Асмагул планирует приобрести торговую точку под свою собственность, чтобы больше не платить за аренду.
texts.en:
Asmagul is an experienced vendor from the city of Dushanbe. She is 44 years old. She has been bringing up her children on her own. She has a 13-year old son and an 18-year old daughter. Her son is in school, and her daughter finished school last year.
Asmagul started her own small business seven years ago. She sells vegetables at the market. Her children also help her out as this is the only source of income for her family. At present, Asmagul needs a loan. She needs to restock her wares and also have the necessary renovations done in her house. She lacks sufficient funds to do so, which is why she is applying for a loan. In the future Asmagul plans to buy her own sales stand in order to stop paying for a lease.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale as well as to renovate her home.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She would like to apply for a loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Desideria has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from food vending.

Desideria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an automotive shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Eufemia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business.

Eufemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero, vive con una hermana en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace más de 4 años que vende frutas y verduras como ser sandias, tomate, manzanas, papas,  limones, y huevos. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos. Ha solicitado 10,000 Lempiras para  comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, huevos, frutas y verduras para aumentar las ventas y los clientes. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en: Luis is 50 years old, single, and lives with a sister in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. He has always worked in agriculture. For over 4 years, he has sold fruits and vegetables such as watermelon, tomatoes, apples, potatoes, lemons and eggs. He has this business in his house and it is his source of income. He has asked for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase rice, beans, corn, eggs, fruits and vegetables to increase his sales and customer base. His goal is to grow his business in order to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, eggs, fruit, and vegetables to increase his sales and customer base.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives with her husband and two little children in Kapan town.  She provides foreign language (English and Russian) classes to her students from her house. The room that she uses for her classes is too small, and Anahit isn't able to receive more than three students. She has requested this loan to be able to purchase chairs and a table for her working room. The loan will also be used for purchasing notebooks and for making her classes more effective. 

Anahit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for notebooks, chairs and a table for providing education to her students.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Zahida has also been doing her business of cloth selling for many years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Zahida needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business.  Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business. For this financial assistance Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a different variety of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of two daughters. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He drives an auto rickshaw day and night. He has been continuously driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, for the maintenance of the rickshaw. Her husband wants to maintain the engine and body of the rickshaw. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to his business.

Asma thanks Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband pay for the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 38-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons. Her husband has been doing his own business of scrap recycling. He is the only one responsible for managing the entire household.

Nazia's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore, Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap in bulk for recycling purposes.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and two sons. Her husband owns a small gemstone shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case to attract customers.  

He has only one source of income.  He has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Shama has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, so her husband can increase the inventory and earnings, as well.  She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members can pass through their lives comfortably.

Shama is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to help her husband buy gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells motorbike spare parts, such as break shoes, break levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, headlights, batteries, etc. He has been doing this business for many years and earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. Her husband is the single person who has to support his family and older parents also. The spare parts shop is the single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to know that he has a need to grow his business, so that he could easily cope with these future expenses. 
Therefore, Kousar has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

Kousar is the age of 48, mother of two daughters and three sons, who are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her daughter and old parents as well.  She hopes that her husband will succeed in his future plans, and this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Kousar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as break shoes, break levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, headlights, batteries etc. for resale.

loans.name: Glenda Armida

texts.es:
Glenda, se dedica a elaborar y vender antojitos como yuca frita, tostadas, empanadas, etc., todos los días en el mercado de su ciudad, vive junto a su esposo de 40 años de edad y sus hijos de 18, 15, 10 años de edad respectivamente. Todos le colaboran en el negocio.
Utilizara el crédito para surtir con materia prima su negocio, comprara yuca, azúcar, plátanos, aceite, bolsas, aceite, leña, sal entre otros materiales, permitiéndole seguir trabajando y generando los ingresos que necesita para colaborar en los gastos de su casa.
Glenda anhela mejorar su situación económica para comprar su casa propia, tener un negocio autosostenible y ofrecer oportunidades de superación académica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Glenda has a business making and selling snacks, such as fried cassava, tostadas, empanadas, etc.  She sells every day in the market in her city.  She lives with her husband, 40, and her children, aged 18, 15 and 10.  They all contribute to the business.

Glenda will use this loan to stock her business with raw materials.  She will buy cassava, sugar, bananas, cooking oil, plastic bags, firewood, salt, and other supplies.  This will allow her to continue to work and generate the income she needs to contribute toward the household expenses.

Glenda wants to improve her financial situation so that she can buy her own house, have a self-sustaining business, and offer her children opportunities for academic achievement.

loans.use: to buy cassava, sugar, bananas, and other supplies

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 44-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells fodder in a nearby village.  Here most of the people keep cattle in their houses for getting milk, beef, and mutton for their cart. There is a lot of demand for fodder for those people who keep cattle. His shop is situated in a poor society and most of his customers took fodder on a credit basis and do not pay back for many days. Now, his credit amount has gone out of its limit.  Even he cannot buy fresh fodder to sell. 

Safia is a poor lady and cannot sustain such kind of irregularities in payments because fodder selling is the only one way of getting income for her family. Therefore, Safia has requested a loan for her husband so he would be able to buy fodder to sell.  Now, her husband will avoid selling fodder on a credit basis.  She hopes that this loan can easily fulfill the deficiencies.

Safia is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to help her husband buy cattle fodder for reselling.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo vive en la provincia de Pacuartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona trabajadora y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él compra ganados pequeños y los hace engordar para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias ganaderas del departamento del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal " Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo alimento como forrajes. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Justo lives in the province of Pacuartambo, in the region of Cusco, in southern Peru. He is a humble and hard-working farmer who also raises cattle. He buys young animals and fattens them to sell them at various cattle fairs throughout Cusco. He belongs to communal bank 'Los Paccollos' and asks for a loan in order to buy fodder. He thanks lenders for their support and promises to be very responsible and punctual in his repayments.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Josué Jeremías

texts.es:
Josué tiene 34 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a lo domestico, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en la escuela, por lo tanto solo sus hijos y esposa dependen de él.

Josué es agricultor desde que tenia 15 años de edad, lo aprendió gracias a su padre que lo llevaba al campo y así fue aprendiendo a realizar esta actividad, ahora se dedica a cuidar una finca que está a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa y viaja a pie. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar el  abono, fertilizantes, la semilla de maíz y frijol, además de eso tiene que pagarle a un ayudante que lo acompaña en el trabajo.

Sus sueños son poder gozar de buena salud para tener fuerzas y no dejar de cultivar ya que tiene un hogar que mantener.
texts.en: Josué is 34 and studied up to the ninth form. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the household. They have three children, two of whom go to school. His only dependents are his children and his wife. Josué has been a farmer since he was 15 years old, having learned the trade from his father, who took him to the fields as a child and taught him everything he knew. Josué works on a plot of land 20 minutes from his home and goes there on foot. He needs a loan to buy manure, fertiliser, sweetcorn and broad beans seeds, and to hire a farm hand. His dreams include staying healthy and strong so as to keep farming, since he has a family to support.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, seeds, and hire a farm hand.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Nuevo Imperial.
Este joven emprendedor desde hace varios años trabaja en la UGEL de la ciudad donde reside.

Sus amigos afirman que es una persona muy amable y luchadora. Desde muy joven ha trabajado y estudiado en la Universidad para poder salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus padres.

Su mayor motivación en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios.
Es por eso que Edwin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá destinar ese dinero en cubrir algunas necesidades personales y así seguir estudiando y graduarse próximamente.
texts.en: Edwin is single and lives in the district of Nuevo Imperial. This enterprising young man has worked for several years in the UGEL of the city where he lives. His friends state that he's a very friendly and hard-working person. Since a very young age he has worked and studied at the university to get ahead and be able to help his parents. The biggest motivation in his life is to finish his studies at the university. That's why Edwin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to use the money to cover a few personal needs, continue studying, and graduate in the near future.

loans.use: To cover a few personal needs.

loans.name: Jan

texts.en: Jan is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for fifteen years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs maintenance on his taxi, because the current condition of it is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance repairs on his taxi. Therefore Jan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Jan's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Jan also plans to make savings with the profits of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Jan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cassava, onions, etc.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado debido a la pobreza en que vivian sus padres, así es que decidió mejor trabajar, esta casado y su esposa se dedica al los oficios domésticos y también lo apoya en la agricultura, tiene 6 hijos de ellos 4 están acompañados. Los dos que viven con ellos están estudiando el bachillerato que son hembras.


José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres , aveces trabaja como albañil trabajo que lo aprendió con un amigo. José manifiesta, que su vida no ha sido nada fácil le ha tocado trabajar muy duro. Se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para prepararse he irse al trabajo donde tiene que caminar. En la agricultura trabaja 6 horas y cuando trabaja en la albañileria trabaja 9 horas.


El crédito que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para invertirlo en la siembra de pipían y maíz, comprara semilla, abono y veneno.


El sueño de José es que sus dos hijas ultimas se gradúen en la universidad, poder pagar  el crédito y mejorar su vivienda para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y esposa.
texts.en: José is 56 years old and studied only up to the sixth form because his family was very poor. He decided it was better to start working early. He has a wife, who takes care of the household and helps him with the farming. They have 6 children, 4 of whom are married. The remaining two, both daughters, live with them and are working towards their high school diploma. José has been a farmer for 10 years. He learned the trade from his parents. From time to time, he also works as a bricklayer, thanks to a friend who taught him the ropes. He says his life has never been easy and that it seems to have been his lot to work very hard. He wakes up at 5 am every morning to get ready to go to work, since he has to walk to get there. When he works as a farmer, he works for 6 hours, and 9 if he works as a bricklayer. He asks for a loan in order to buy farming supplies to grow squash and sweetcorn: he needs seeds, manure, and poison. José's dream is to see his two youngest daughters graduate from university. He wants to pay back the loan and to improve his house so as to ensure a better quality of life for his wife and his daughters.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to tend to his crops.

loans.name: José Moisés

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, su esposa no trabaja ya que tiene problemas para caminar y sus hijos viven de manera independiente.


José tiene 40 años de experiencia en trabajos de carpintería, trabajo que aprendió con su padre y en vista de las pocas oportunidades de empleo formal.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es  para comprar madera y tener siempre disponible para fabricar y reparar los muebles que sus vecinos necesitan.

José  sueña con tener 2 vacas de raza lechera para asegurar su alimentación y tener algún ingreso extra.
texts.en:
Jose, 64, studied until the sixth grade. He is married and has two adult sons. His wife does not work as she already has trouble walking and their children live independently. 

Jose has forty years of experience working as a carpenter, which he learned from his father as there were few opportunities of formal employment.
The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy wood so he will always have wood available to make and fix the furniture that his neighbors need.

Jose dreams of having two milk cows to assure a source of food and to make some extra income.

loans.use: to buy wood and always have it available to make and repair the furniture that his neighbors need.

loans.name: Leonid Camaro

texts.es:
En el pequeño taller de soldadura de Leonid, una varilla de hierro, poco atractiva, toma una forma diferente, el arte y la concentración se combinan en su trabajo, elabora desde decoraciones básicas hasta portones para el hogar. El tiene la edad de 33 años, está en unión libre y tiene un hijo. Hace tres años inició su negocio con la ayuda de su madre, invirtió el dinero de las remesas en su pequeño taller, el que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. 
El solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo, requiere comprar varillas para soldar, soldador, estaño, alicates, pinzas, tijeras, entre otras herramientas. El deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ofrecerle salud y educación de calidad. Su hermano es su mano derecha, juntos luchan por obtener más clientes y mejores ingresos. Una de sus metas es tener un taller más grande con varios trabajadores, no se detendrá hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
In Leonid's small welding shop, an iron rod, unattractive, takes a different form. Art and concentration are combined in his work, producing everything from basic decorations to gates for the home.

He is 33 years old, cohabiting with a partner and has a son. He began his business three years ago with help from his mother. 

He invested money from remittances in his small workshop, which has become his main source of income.

He is asking for a loan for working capital. He needs to buy welding rods, soldering iron, tin, pliers, tweezers, scissors, and other tools. 

He places trust in funding, since he wants to improve the lives of his family and provide them with good health and education. 

His brother is his right hand, and together they strive to get more customers and better income. 

One of his goals is to have a larger workshop with various workers. He will not stop until he achieves this.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering iron, tin, pliers, tweezers, scissors, and other tools.

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en:
Farkhanda is 45, a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns a scrap goods shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Now, due to household expenses. he does not have the money to buy scrap and therefore does not have scrap to sell to the recycling factories.
Therefore, Farkhanda has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 38-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a butcher shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them from his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which limited his purchasing power for new inventory. 
Therefore, Mussarat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan, so that her husband can buy broilers to sell at his shop. She dreams of providing all facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: To buy broilers for resale.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 42-year-old mother of five children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he has been selling fresh fruit from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of his fruit. Therefore, Salma has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruit. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is 29 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Farhat has contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel, and wants to pay labor costs to cover it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Farhat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain a rickshaw.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramon vive en la provincia de Pacuartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona trabajadora y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos donde cultiva papa, cebollas, cebada, trigo y otros, él pertenece al banco comunal " Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Ramon lives in the province of Pacuartambo, in the region of Cusco, in southern Peru. He is a humble and hard-working farmer who also raises cattle. He has several plots of land on which he grows potatoes, onions, barley, wheat, and other crops. He belongs to communal bank 'Los Paccollos' and asks for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertiliser. He thanks lenders for their support and promises to be very responsible and punctual in his repayment.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Marinil

texts.en:
Marinil is 31 years old and married with two children, who are in school.  Marinil works very hard to provide for them.

Marinil's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marinil has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marinil has taken a PHP 9825 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marinil is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, ha tenido un efecto positivo con la inversión del crédito anterior, la granja de pollos ofrece más producto fresco y de calidad, sus clientes están satisfechos, tanto las ventas como los ingresos son mejores. Ha mejorado positivamente las circunstancias familiares y  cancelo con buen record el crédito.
Con el objetivo de seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio se decidió por solicitar más capital para invertirlo en la compra de concentrado, pollos de engorde, vacunas, bombillos y comederos, de esta manera mantendrá en buenas condiciones sus aves y será más fácil comercializarlas.
texts.en:
Juan had a good result with the previous loan.  His poultry farm offers more fresh, high quality products, his customers are satisfied, and both his sales and income are higher. He has positively improved his family circumstances and paid off his loan with good standing.   

With the goal to continue working in order to expand his business, he decided to ask for another loan and invest it in the purchase of chicken feed, chickens for fattening, vaccines, light bulbs and troughs, and in this way he will maintain his poultry in good conditions and it will be easier to sell them.

loans.use: purchase chicken feed, chickens for fattening, vaccines, light bulbs, and troughs

loans.name: Santos Marcos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar esta acompañado  y su pareja se dedica a lo domestico, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres viven con él.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño su padre, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos  y él viaja a pie, esta es la única actividad que el realiza y dos hijos le ayudan en el trabajo, y lo hacen durante la mañana.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar un terreno que le venden cerca del otro que está cultivando.

Sus sueños son seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old.  He did not have the opportunity to go to school.  He has a partner and she takes care of the domestic chores.  He has 5 children, 3 of whom live with him. 

Santos has worked in agriculture since was 10 years old. His father taught him this job. He works 20 minutes from his home, and he goes by foot.  This is his only job and two children help him with it; they work in the mornings.

He needs the loan to purchase land that is for sale near the other plat that he is farming.

His dream is to continue farming the land and have enough to sustain his home.

loans.use: to purchase land that is for sale near the other plot that he is farming.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 46-year-old married woman, living along with her spouse, three daughters and three sons in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She is receiving this loan for her son. He sells coal from his shop because in his area a gas supply is not available and most of the people like coal for cooking purposes. He supplies this coal to the chef for steaming. Her son has developed a list of good customers and he wants to increase the supply of coal available to sell. 
Safia is in her 11th loan cycle. She has been taking loans for her husband’s business, but this time she has requested a Kiva loan to support her son. He will buy sacks of coal so he can help her own family and sibling as well.
She hopes that this loan will prove productive, not only for her son's business, but for the family as well. She is very thankful to Kiva and appreciates the warm support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sacks of coal for resale.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and three children. Her husband owns a small gemstone shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  He has only one source of income, and he alone has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children and household expenses. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Ishrat has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Kiva Pakistan, so her husband can increase the inventory and earnings as well. She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members can pass their lives comfortably. Ishrat is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and two children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklace, rings, and ear rings. He shows his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  
He has only one source of income. He has had the expense of many utility bills, school fees for his children, and household expenses. The condition of the family house is not up to the mark.
He wants to construct a new house for his family. For this purpose more earnings are required so that the money for construction can be saved from his business. Therefore, Asma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s brac Pakistan, so that her husband can increase the inventory and thereby the earnings as well.
She hopes that the house will be build soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.
Asma is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy jewelry such as bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, and ear rings for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal " Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco in southern Peru. She is a straightforward and respectful person who works in agriculture and raises livestock. She has several pieces of farmland where she plants barley, beans, potato, wheat, quinoa, kiwicha and other things. 

She is part of the "Los Paccollos" community bank and at this time wants the loan to buy seed and fertilizers. She thanks all of the investors for the support provided and is committed to very responsibly making the scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith de 58 años de edad habita en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hijo en la edad de  17 años. Como comerciante tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Ella al recibir la pensión por tiempo laboral, necesitaba ocupar su tiempo libre y decidió aprender y hace 2 años emprender su negocio en el cual vende productos de belleza especialmente. Sus ventas las realiza directamente a su clientela a crédito desde los lunes hasta los sábados, desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, comprando de contado, Su meta es convertirse en directora de un equipo comercial para impulsar sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de tocador y para el hogar, abriendo nuevas opciones para su clientela, con este capital podrá continuar invirtiendo mientras recauda sus cuentas por cobrar mes a mes.
texts.en: Edith, 58 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad with her husband and her 17-year-old child. She has 8 years of experience as a businesswoman. Upon receiving her pension, she needed a way to occupy her free time and decided to learn and two years ago, she established her business in which she sells beauty products specifically. She makes her sales directly to the customer on credit from Monday to Saturday, from 2:00 to 7:00 in the evening, in cash. Her goal is to become the director of a business team to increase her sales. At the moment, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase toiletries and things for the home, opening new options for her customers, and with this capital, she will be able to continue investing while she collects her accounts to pay month by month.

loans.use: to purchase toiletries and items for the home

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gertrudes is 48 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Gertrudes has a buy and sell business in the Philippines. Gertrudes requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock like slippers, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Gertrudes has been in this business for twenty years. Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like slippers, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. Besides the charcoal selling business, Amina operates a motorcycle.
She is requesting for a loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to replace the old one.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en:
Elya is from Kapan town where she lives with her retired mother. Elya has been involved in cosmetics sales for 3 years. She trades with different types of cosmetic goods from her house and has a large number of loyal clients. ELya has now requested this loan to pay for new stock of cosmetics for resale to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, for informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
This loan will be a large support for Elya's small business and she will be very grateful to all lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 46-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruits selling business. Her husband sells seasonal fruit over a donkey cart. He purchases seasonal fruit in bulk and sells it over the cart. Now he wants to buy melons and watermelons in a large quantity to sell because this is the season and prices are very low.
 
Therefore, Abida has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy the melons and watermelons. 
She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her husband and she will save a reasonable amount from the profits. Abida is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy melons and watermelons in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 48-years old woman, living with her eight children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son has been working driving an auto rickshaw for another person. With the help of savings he wants to purchase a new auto rickshaw, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new rickshaw. He wants to start driving for his own business.
Therefore, Kaneez has requested a loan for her son so he can buy new rickshaw and can drive his rickshaw happily. She hopes that now her son will be able to generate a constant income. She is very happy after taking this loan. Her thanks to Kiva and the fliend partner, brac Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en: Mafia is a 34-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his Nursery to resell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old. She is married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She has been running her business for 10 years, now, and she has one employee. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 24,000. She will use this amount to buy more stock to sell to her community. She will use her income to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Luciana requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Luciana would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gleceria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Gleceria has been in pig fattening for two years and earns additional income from farming bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Ciro es propietario de un negocio de llantería y venta de accesorios para vehiculos, experiencia que data desde hace 18 años, cuando captó que no existia este tipo de negocios en el sector y como tenia conocimiento decidió emprender su aventura empresarial. Su actividad diaria desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, desde los lunes a los domingos, consiste en ofrecer servicios de mantenimiento y reparacion de llantas y aplicacion de adornos o accesorios a vehiculos que lo requieren. Ciro compra de contado en almacenes de reppuestos especializados. Su meta es dar apertura a un almcen y mas adelante tener sucursales.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos y accesorios para vehiculos. Con esta inversión podrá responder en su nuevo almacen a los clientes que potencialmente planea aumentar.
texts.en:
Ciro is the owner of a tire and vehicle accessory shop, which dates back to 18 years ago when he realized that this type of business did not exist in the area. Since he had the knowledge, he decided to undertake this business venture. He works from 7 in the morning until 8 at night, Monday through Sunday, offering maintenance services, tire repair, and application of parts and accessories on vehicles that require it. Ciro uses cash to buy parts in specialized replacement part warehouses. His goal is to open a warehouse and later open more branches.

Currently, he is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first funding that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation has provided, through which he will purchase vehicle replacement parts and accessories. With this investment, he will be able to serve clients in his new warehouse that he potentially plans to expand.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle replacement parts and accessories

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 44 years old and married with six children.

Luvisminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luvisminda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income selling reloads/minutes for mobile phones.

Luvisminda aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: José William

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora en la agricultura pues desde muy pequeño aprendió,  ya que su padre le enseño, a la escuela solo asistió hasta segundo grado, ya que las condiciones económicas de sus padres no eran suficientes para que él siguiera con sus estudios.  Además la distancia y el riesgo natural de dos ríos que tiene que cruzar hasta llegar el terreno donde trabaja; siempre ha sido bien dedicado a la agricultura, en especial al cultivo de granos básicos y el cultivo del café, de los cuales obtiene ingresos para su familia, él trabaja todos los días desde las 6:00 am.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas y herbicidas. Él espera tener buena productividad y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, él planea a futuro, construir su casita formar una familia, y tener algo que ofrecerle a su futura esposa e hijos, por quienes trabaja fuertemente para que tengan por lo menos lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
José, 21 years old, is a very hardworking person and has worked in agriculture since he was very young.  His father taught him how to do the work. He only attended school until the second grade, since his parents' economic situation was not sufficient for him to continue studying. In addition to the distance, there is the natural danger of having to cross two rivers to arrive at the land where he works. He has always worked hard in agriculture, specifically growing basic grains and coffee, from which he earns income for his family.  He works every day starting at 6:00 am. 

The loan that he is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to purchase natural and chemical fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and herbicides.  He hopes to have good productivity and to improve his family's quality of life.  In the future, he plans to build a small house, have a family, and have something to offer his future wife and children, for whom he works hard so that they could have at least the necessities.

loans.use: to purchase natural and chemical fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa is a married woman, and she has one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop, in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, including bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera ya que se separó del esposo por problemas personales, tiene una hija y vive en casa de sus padres.

Xiomara se dedica al trabajo doméstico pero también a la agricultura, ella cuida a dos sobrinas, además se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años, esto lo hace ayudándole al papá ya que solo ellos dos son los que pueden trabajar en la agricultura para realizar este trabajo se va a pie y lo hace durante la mañana.

El préstamo solicitado para comprar todos los fertilizantes que utilizará en la  milpa, abono y veneno para la siembra.

Los sueños de Xiomara son seguir trabajando en la agricultura, seguir apoyando al papá en el trabajo de la agricultura, darle a la hija todo lo que ella necesite y que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 27 years old, went to school until the ninth grade, is a single mother since she separated from her husband for personal reasons, and has a daughter.  She lives in her parents' house.

Xiomara works as a domestic but also in agriculture. She takes care of her two nieces, in addition she has worked in agriculture for the past three years, helping her father since it is only the two of them who can do agricultural work. To do this work, she goes by foot and works in the mornings.

She asks for the loan to purchase all the fertilizer that she will use in the corn field, manure and weed killer.

Xiomara's dreams are to continue working in agriculture, continue helping her father with the agricultural work, and give her daughter everything she needs so she isn't lacking for anything.

loans.use: to purchase all the fertilizers that she will use in the corn field, manure and weed killer.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is married and has nine school aged children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past eight years she has operated a poultry business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With this loan she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ma. Catalina

texts.en: Ma. Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in business for 9 years now. She has requested a loan of 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients for her business. In the future, Ma. Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Evans, a self-driven farmer who lives in the Kisii area of Kenya. This is primarily a bananas-and-sugar-cane-growing region. The father of five has been doing farm work for the past 12 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and bananas, which are produced on his farm. He is also involved in other personal businesses, to generate additional income.

Evans is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He wants to expand his dairy section, because it is less reliant on rainfall. This will guarantee him reliable, regular income.

He is very agreeable towards the notion that farming is a big business. "Farming has sustained me economically for a very long time. I have lived the last 12 years being financially stable, without having to deal with a boss," he stated. However, his biggest challenge is the poor condition of the roads that lead to the market. Evans's biggest expense is school fees.

With your loan, Evans promises his family an improvement in their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Arhahama est une commerçante depuis 12 ans, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Mapendo», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse divers articles et sociétaire d’une quincaillerie. Elle étale ses business dans un centre commercial de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter divers matériels de plomberie et construction(tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles etc.). Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
This client, Arhahama, has been a merchant for twelve years and is the president of the business group “Mapendo”. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 38 years old and a married mother of nine children, who are all students. She is a vendor of a variety of good and an associate of a hardware store. She sets up her business in a commercial center in town.

Arhahama is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase various plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, screens, nails, cables, etc.) She had started off with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to progress in her business, build a house, and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system while granting them loans without the need for collateral, especially during this time post-conflict in the countries east.

loans.use: to purchase various plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, screens, nails, cables, etc.)

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 32 years old. He is married with one child. He has been a rice farmer for the past eight years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married with three school going children. They live in a house that they own, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from her home to her neighbors and dreams of establishing a small green grocer in the future. With the loan, Veronica wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for her food stall.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 56-year-old married woman from the village of Natanebi, Ozurgeti district. She is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Manana is engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivation of nuts. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. Manana has a great desire to do her bit for the family's welfare and start her own activity. 

She received a loan in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money, she will purchase stock of various home products at wholesale prices and will sell among her villagers door-to-door. It is obvious that the job is hard for Manana, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a trading business with various home products

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
Oscar, vive junto a su familia integrada por su padre de 50 años, su madre de 45 años y sus hermanas de 15 y 18 años de edad, viven en casa propia, en busca de independencia y por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su familia, emprendió su negocio de venta de CDS, DVDS y otros productos, su puesto está ubicado en las afueras del mercado.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de CDS, DVDS, jabón, pastas dentales, cerillos y otros productos que ofrece en su negocio, así tendrá suficiente mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes, por la naturaleza de la misma no corre el peligro de dañarse por un largo tiempo. 
Su aspiración es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para comprar su casa propia, apoyar a sus padres y cubrir las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his family, which is composed of his father and mother, ages 50 and 45, and his sisters, ages 15 and 18. They live in their own home. 

He started his business selling CDs, DVDs, and other products because he wanted to be independent, and he needed to help with his family's expenses. His stand is located on the outskirts of the market.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of CDs, DVDs, toothpaste, matches, and other products that he sells. This way, he will have enough merchandise to satisfy his customers, which will protect him for a long time. 

He wants to save enough to buy his own house, support his parents, and cover his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, DVDs, soap, toothpaste, matches, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, pepper, and candy for her business.

loans.name: Guya

texts.en:
