Guya is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She has been operating a charcoal-selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 28 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 28 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman with three school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has no piped water but has electricity. 

Everline has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a new borrower, aged 45 years old, who is a married man with  7 children. That is quite a big number, and he has to struggle to take care of them considering his status as peasant. He could not do it on his his own since he has no financial standing. He has therefore applyed for a loan of 3,500,000 UGX, to help him buy cows, which he fattens and then sells at a profit. 

Nicholas has enough farm land, but he does have enough cows to occupy that land. This lack of adequate animals is a challenge, and buying more would help him increase his income, which would help him to adequately meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a 32-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand. Maricel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old and widowed with five children. All five children are currently in school, and Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 10 years, Rosalina has been running a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, eggs, rice, canned goods, cooking oil, and noodles to stock in her store.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, eggs, rice, canned goods, cooking oil, and noodles for her store.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty is 60 years old and single. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Letty is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Letty has been sustaining her business activities through her 26 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Pascalia, a hardworking lady who practises mixed farming in Kisii village, Kenya which is not far from Maasai land. The mother of five has been doing this work for 18 years now! She gets money by selling milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also ventures into small seasonal businesses to make extra money. 

Pascalia is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She is assured of more income since the need for dairy products has grown just as the price of milk has always improved. Her biggest challenge though is poor roads making transportation very difficult and expensive.

When asked how the loan will benefit her family, Pascalia's  response was to afford her family a better living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Venancie

texts.en:
Venancie is 45 years old. She is a mother of ten children, five of whom are in school. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers that will help increase the production of her rice farming. With profits from this farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay hired labor for rice production.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 50 years old. He has spent eight years growing rice. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers that will help increase the production of his crops. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is 41 years old. She is married with five children aged between fifteen and twenty two years. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her rice production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives with her husband and son in Kapan town. The family is involved in the retail business. They started selling fruits and vegetables in a small garage near their house. This business is the only source of income for this family, so it is very important to them. 

Marieta has now requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables for selling to locals in Kapan town. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Marieta to continue their family business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of fruits and vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Edymar Santos

texts.es:
Edymar  tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico,  tiene dos hijos de os cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela.

Él trabaja como comerciante, tiene un carro donde anda vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en el hogar, también trabaja en la agricultura para que el maíz no le falte a la familia, ya tiene 3 años de realizar esta actividad.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar tres sacos de abono, semilla y medio galón de veneno para regarle a la parcela que cultivara esto le va ayudar de mucho ya que tendrá todo preparado con tiempo.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, que Dios bendiga su trabajo de comerciante, pues necesita seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Edymar is 33 years old and went to school until high school. He is in a relationship, and his partner works in the home. He has two children, one of whom is in school.

He works as a mobile vendor; he has a car from which he sells necessary household products. He also works in agriculture so that his family has enough to eat; he has worked in this area for three years now.

He needs the requested loan to purchase to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, seed, and a half gallon of herbicide to apply to the plot that he will cultivate. This will help him a lot because he will have everything ready in advance.

His dreams are to continue working and that God will bless his work as a vendor because he needs to move forward, together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, seed, and a half gallon of herbicide to apply to his plot

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer emprendedora, madre de 2 hijos menores y con una actitud positiva frente a los problemas que se le presentan.
Ella es separada y desde ese momento se vio obligada a tomar las riendas del hogar para conseguir recursos y sostener a sus hijos.
Ella ha desempeñado varios rolles, desde vendedora por catalogo, pasando por vendedora de helados y hoy en día está dedicada a la venta de verduras y legumbres.
Ella trabaja duramente todos los días con el afán de aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ingresos.
Tiene un problema y es que el capital de trabajo es muy poco y siente que a veces no tiene como sostener su negocio, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar surtido de verduras para abastecer su negocio. De este modo podrá tener variedad y cantidades disponibles para sus clientes, esto impactara de manera positiva sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising woman and the mother of two young children. She has a positive attitude in the face of the problems that she encounters.

She is separated and from that time on, she has needed to take the reins of the household to obtain resources and support her children. She has filled various roles, from catalog saleswoman to ice cream vendor to her current job selling vegetables and legumes.

She works hard every day, with the desire to increase sales and receive more income. Her problem is that she has very little capital and feels that sometimes she doesn't have enough to sustain her business. For this reason, she is requesting financial support to invent in her business and purchase a variety of vegetables to stock her business. In this way, she will be able to have better variety and quality available for her customers, which will positively impact her profits.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla has a retail shop in Tala town where she sells both household and retail items. She is 62 years old and married and has been in this business for the past 15 years. Her estimated monthly income is KES 26,000.

This being her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, she plans to buy more stock of retail goods to sell and buy animal feeds. These include sugar, rice and flour. She will use the generated income to build a house. She would like a loan of KES 45,000.

She hopes to be successful in her business and be able to provide for the needs of her grandchildren such as school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, flour and other items to sell and animal feed.

loans.name: Kioko

texts.en:
Kioko is 51 years old. He is married and together with his wife has been blessed with two children. He has been running his business for eight years and currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 70,000. 

He would like to expand his business and would like a loan of KES 36,000 through which he will top-up his loan and expand his business. From his income, he will buy fertilizer for growing vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nazaria works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Nazaria is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nazaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables, spices, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Guida

texts.en:
Guida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Guida is 39 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Guida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Guida has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Helen has been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Merlita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy tailoring materials for her tailoring business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 36 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, shampoo, rice, noodles, beers, etc. to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, rice, noodles, beers, etc. 

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, shampoo, rice, noodles, beers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Rebecca from Kisii, an area of Kenya with constant rainfall throughout the year. The mother of three has been a farmer for 21 years! She keeps poultry and dairy cattle for eggs, meat, and milk. It is on the same small plot of land that she grows tea and bananas. She makes a living selling produce from her farm to the local market.
 
Rebecca is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Compared to items from other sectors, promotion of milk is very easy. There is no need for unique stores and costs of promotion are very low for any dairy. "The only way to grow as a dairy farmer is by producing more milk through improved management, improved cattle breeds, and purchasing more cattle," said Rebecca. Tending to animals is what she stated to be the most enjoyable thing about her business. "Keeping animals is like having different type of babies. They need all the attention they can get if you want them to be productive," she said. 

Poor roads and lack of market are big challenges to farmers from Kisii like Rebecca. She also finds her children's high school fees prohibitive to business expansion. With your loan, Rebecca will increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ibangaryiza Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée fait partie du groupe Ibangaryiza  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans  et est mariée  à Pascal, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  bananes   depuis  4  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre    pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Dorothée is part of the group Ibangaryiza and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Pascal, a merchant. Together, they have five children, all students. 

Dorothée has been doing commerce in bananas for four years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Intambwe Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe Intambwe  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 42 ans  et est mariée  à Evariste, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants  dont 6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane  depuis  15  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de litre de bière de banane à revendre   pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anastasie is part of the group Intambwe and lives in Gitega. She is 42 years old and married to Evariste, a merchant. Together, they have seven children, of whom six are students. 

Anastasie has been doing commerce in banana beer for fifteen years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many liters of banana beer to resell, so as to earn more

loans.use: to purchase many liters of banana beer to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti appreciates the previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase ten pieces of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase ten pieces of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for resale

loans.name: Salomon Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mate est une brave commerçante, conseillère et membre de la banque villageoise «Salomon», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 64ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est   vendeuse de la boisson. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette à son domicile dans un quartier animé de la ville, où, il a su gagner sa clientèle. Il commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 21 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 caisses de fanta, 5 caisses de bière Primus, 2 meetzing et 2 simba. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits et petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Mate is a brave merchant, advisor, and member of the banque villageois Salomon. She is a dynamic, older entrepreneur, who is 64 years old, a widow, and a mother of four children. All of the children go to school.

Mate has been selling drinks for 21 years. She started this business from funds from her husband, while he was still alive. Later she benefited from a loan with Hekima. She sells her goods from a refreshment stand at her home and in a busy part of town, where she has gained customers.

This new loan will serve to buy five cases of Fanta, five cases of Primus beer, two [cases of] Muetzig beer, and two [cases of] Simba beer.

Mate wishes to [continue to] feed and school her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping small-scale entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system, become independent.

loans.use: to buy five cases of Fanta, five cases of Primus beer, two [cases of] Muetzig beer, and two [cases of] Simba beer

loans.name: Ukurikwose Group

texts.fr:
Elisabeth  fait partie du groupe Ukurikwose  et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de  56 ans et
 elle a 5 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de  cacahouètes   depuis 14  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de cacahouètes  à revendre    pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is part of the group Ukurikwose and lives in Gitega. She is a 56-year-old widow and has five children. 

Elisabeth has been doing commerce in peanuts for fourteen years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of peanuts to resell, so as to earn more

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of peanuts to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Bao Wend Som Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHARLOTTE  représente le groupe  BAO WEND SOM. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgée a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des gâteaux depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de farine, 01bidon d’huile, 04kg de sucre, 01paquet de levure, un peu de bicarbonate, 01tas de bois et une barrique d’eau.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner et réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne devenir grossiste dans son domaine.
texts.en:
Ms. CHARLOTTE represents the group BAO WEND SOM. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3. One goes to school. 

Ms. CHARLOTTE has been selling cakes for three years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. She wants to purchase a sack of flour, a container of oil, 4 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, a bit of bicarbonate, a pile of wood, and a barrel of water. With her profits, she wants to save money and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler in her domain.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of flour, a container of oil, 4 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, a bit of bicarbonate, a pile of wood, and a barrel of water

loans.name: Habzeta's Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABZETA représente le groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgée a 26ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des gâteaux depuis 16ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 02sacs de farine et 01 bidon d’huile de 20l.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. HABZETA represents the group. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 11. Two go to school. 

Ms. HABZETA has been selling cakes for sixteen years. She gets her supplies from the stores in her sector. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of flour and a 20-liter container of oil. With her profits, she wants to bolster her business. Her ambition is to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of flour and a container of oil

loans.name: Ahmad Razaq

texts.en:
Ahmad Razaq is 26-year-old man. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a medical store in which he has been selling medicines of all types for many years. Due to increasing financial needs, he wants to grow his business. His medical store is near a medical clinic, with most of the customers referred by the doctor of that clinic. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost.

Ahmad Razaq knows that he can earn maximum profit if he offered these missing medicines. Therefore he has requested a loan for his business; he hopes that he would be able to buy medicine so that he could earn maximum profit. 

Ahmad Razaq hopes that with the profit he will be able to buy a new house soon. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines for medical store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is 45 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with 3 children. She has been running her business for 5 years now.

She would like a loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to buy more cereals like maize, beans and peas to sell to clients in her area. 

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 22,800 KES. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. Her income will be used to buy food and basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to add cereals like maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Remedios is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc., for her general store business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 55 years old. He is married with four children.

He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Laura is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Laura has been in pig fattening for 19 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Asante Mungu K Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mupungu est une commerçante depuis 15 ans et membre d’une plate forme d’Affaires «Asante Mungu K» âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 étudient et 5 sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse de récipients vides. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter des bidons, arrosoirs et fus. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs et surtout aux personnes de troisième âge, en leur accordant de crédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Mupungu, has been a merchant for fifteen years and is a member of a business platform called “Asante Mungu K”. She is 60 years old, a widow, and a mother of seven children, of whom two are students, and five are already adults. She is a vendor of empty containers. 

Mupungu is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase jerry cans, watering cans, and casks. At first, she had received funds from her husband when he was still living. She would like to increase her capital and provide schooling to her children. 

She thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs, especially those who are elderly, by granting no-collateral loans to those who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase jerry cans, watering cans, and casks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 51 years old.

Gloria has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a divorced woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline has operated a beauty salon business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the KES 80,000, she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is from Stepanavan town. She is a teacher and mother of a 9-year-old son.
 
Nelli provides language classes to her students from her house. She is a very careful and educated teacher and loves her work very much. The requested loan is very important for her to purchase a computer, a printer, chairs and a table for improving the teaching process. 

Nelli has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan will greatly help Nelli to improve her work and make it effective.

loans.use: to pay for a computer, a printer, chairs and a table.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco, a repeat customer, is a resident of a rural area in Ntungamo district. His major activity is trading cattle and goats, as well as farming. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. He wants to use the money to increase his business by buying more cattle so that he can increase his income. He has a challenge of little income to look after his family. His prime target is to yield high output from his cows and to enroll his children in good schools in the country. But he is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams. With this loan he believes his production will improve and so will his income. This will help to change his lifestyle in society.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Djakarta motorbike to provide transportation services

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est un jeune de 37 ans qui évolue dans le commerce de portables et accessoires. Il est marié et père de famille et vit toujours chez ses parents puisque ses revenus ne lui permettent pas de payer une location. Il participe donc à la dépense quotidienne avec ses frères qui sont aussi là-bas.
Cheikh est resté un temps avant de penser à entrer dans ce commerce, où il a démarré avec ses propres moyens. Il a ensuite amélioré son activité et à a fini par augmenter son capital. C’est dans le cadre de vouloir augmenter son stock, qu’il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter au moins une dizaine de portable et accessoires et revendre.
Cheikh a comme ambition, d’avoir un grand magasin où il pourra associer la vente de produits électroménagers mais cela nécessitant un gros capital, il aura toujours besoin de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a young man, 37 years old, who does commerce in mobile phone and accessories. He is married and a father, and he still lives with his parents, since his income does not allow him to afford rent. So he helps with the day-to-day expenses along with his brothers, who are also there. 

After a while, Cheikh thought to work in commerce, where he started off with his own money. Then he improved his business, and he finally increased his capital. Wanting to increase his inventory, he is requesting this loan to purchase at least a dozen mobile phones and accessories to resell. His ambition is to have a large store, where he will be able to include the sale of household appliances. But this will required a large amount of capital. He will always have need of the microfinance institution IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories to resell

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Florife has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en:
Rose Jean is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Rose Jean has been in this business for 2 years. Rose Jean earns more income from meat vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is 42 years old. She is married with one child. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support the labor costs and to buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay the labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mwafaki

texts.en:
Mwafaki has operated a beauty salon business to earn a living. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan which helped her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers shop. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of Kshs 50,000. She wants to purchase stocks of goods such as sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that has improved her living standards over the years.

Besides the vegetable selling business, Fatuma operates a clothes selling business, selling women's wrap clothes.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer and her husband have been involved in the retail business for 6 years. They trade in fruits and vegetables. Using their own truck, they purchase supplies from the towns of Ashtarak and Ararat and resell them in the town of Vanadzor. The business helps this couple to gather income and sustain their two childrens' living. 

Varditer has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stocks of fruits and vegetables and resell them. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this hard-working couple to continue their small retail business and enlarge it further.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many kinds of soap for her business.

loans.name: Dalva Etelvina

texts.es: Dalva a su corta edad emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 2 años atrás, ella tiene 19 años de edad, comenta que hace un año se graduó del colegio, Dalva  vive con su madre que se dedica a trabajar en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa que en su mayoría es ropa interior, la aspiración de Dalva es incrementar su negocio para que sus ingresos le permitan cubrir los gastos de los estudios universitarios a los que va a asistir, también quisiera ponerse un almacén de ropa para vender la mercadería y de ser posible desea comprarse un vehículo para trasladarse con más facilidad  a las ciudades donde compra la mercadería.
texts.en: Dalva, at her young age, started a business selling clothing two years ago. She is now 19 years old, and she reports that she graduated from high school a year ago. Dalva lives with her mother, who works in agriculture. She will invest the loan in buying clothing as merchandise, mainly undergarments. Dalva's aspiration is to expand her business so that her income will allow her to cover the cost of the university studies she plans to undertake. She would also perhaps like to open a clothing store where she can sell her merchandise, and if possible, she would like to buy a vehicle so that she can travel more easily to the cities where she buys her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor vive en la provincia de Pacuartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él compra ganados pequeños y los hace engordar para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias ganaderas del departamento del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal " Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un pequeño ganado. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Victor lives in Pacuartambo province in Cusco department in southern Peru. He is a respectful and modest person who is engaged in agriculture and livestock-raising. He buys calves and fattens them to later sell in various cattle markets in Cusco department. 

He belongs to the "Los Paccollos"  communal bank, and on this occasion needs the loan to buy a calf. He is grateful to all the investors for the support provided and promises to make his scheduled installment payments very responsibly and on time.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell spice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell for her business.

Marlene has been in this business for 8 years. Marlene earns additional income from food vending.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Michael. He is a smallhold farmer in a deep rural village in Kisii, Kenya. The father of 2 has been farming for 5 years. On his small piece of land he keeps poultry and dairy cows and he grows tea, fruits and vegetables. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and food crops produced on his farm. 
Michael is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He enjoys dairy farming most. "Farm inputs are very expensive. Dairy farming is sustainable because it is with no over reliance on purchased animal food or costly fertilizers." Said the farmer. 
The biggest challenge in Kisii is poor roads that lead to the market making transportation hard and expensive. Due to this challenge, Michael's highest monthly expense is business related. He also finds the children's school fees expense quite high.
With your loan Michael will produce more milk and enjoy a growth in profit margin. The loan will help him have more money to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Keari

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Keari, a farmer who lives with his family on a small piece of land in Kisii, a village neighboring the land of the renowned Maasai community.

Mr. Keari and Mrs. Keari were blessed with one child. They have been practicing agriculture for the last 7 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and food crops produced on his farm. He also engages in other personal business to take better care of his family. 

Keari is appreciative to God that farming has been a good source of income for him and his family. However, the Kisii area has very poor roads. This makes it very hard and expensive for farmers to transport their produce to the market. 

Keari is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. "I prefer dairy farming to other sectors; dairy agriculture is the only industry where earnings are assured every 30 days", he stated. 

More dairy cows will mean more income for Keari.
 
His highest monthly expenses are business-related expenses. The extra income will help him meet such obligations with ease. 

With your loan, Keari seeks to pull his family out of poverty and afford a quality education for his child.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives with her son in Vanadzor. Two years ago she opened a small grocery store, where she sells food and some home supplies. This store is the family's only source of income. Gayane works day and night to run it successfully. Gayane has requested this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of food supplies for her store. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your support is very important for Gayane and her small business, and she hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of food supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .She is married with six children who are adults.

Mealii cooks fried potatoes and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has one child who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more fish for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Tulio Jhon Carlos

texts.es: Tulio de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos no tienen hijos.  El cliente se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, ahora está  invirtiendo en pollos,  necesita el dinero para comprar pollos gallinas y arreglar la champa para que estén mas cómodos y más espaciosos. Su deseo es hacer  que su negocio crezca y que su familia se supere y aumentar su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Tulio is 28 years old and went as far as ninth grade in school. He has a partner who is a housewife. They have no children. 

He has been engaged in agriculture and livestock-raising, and is now investing in chickens. He needs the money to buy chickens and to fix up the chicken coop so that they will be more comfortable and have more space. His wish is to see his business grow, for his family to get ahead in life, and to increase his assets.

loans.use: To buy chickens and repair the chicken coop so that they will be more comfortable and have more space.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta soltera y vive con sus hijos. La cliente se dedica a los oficios domésticos y trabaja por temporadas la agricultura.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para su vivienda, compra de tejas, adobe, madera y así mejorar su vivienda. Ella sueña con dejarle a su familia una casa propia, que sea una casa en la cual puedan crecer y vivir sus nietos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old, single, and lives with her children. She has a third-grade education and works both in her home and as an agricultural day laborer.  

Rosa is applying for a loan to pay for home repairs. She will purchase tiles, adobe, and wood for home improvements. Rosa hopes to leave the home to her family so it can be the place where her grandchildren live and grow up.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, bricks, and wood for home improvements.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Ayawa est une mère de famille vivant dans le quartier BE au centre ville de Lomé au Togo. Avec  4 enfants à charge, Ayawa est aussi commerçante  depuis 1992 de produits alimentaires.  Elle a des difficultés à répondre aux différents besoins de sa clientèle importante et diversifiée faute de stock de produit insuffisant. 
Apres avoir suivi la séance de formation sur la gestion du stock, elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter sont stock de maïs, de riz, du sucre et autres. Le bénéfice de son activité lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses du ménage
texts.en:
Ayawa, aged 43, is the mother of family in the BE district in downtown Lomé, Togo. With four children to support, she has also been a merchant since 1992 selling grocery items. She has some difficulties responding to the different needs of her significant and diversified customer base, since she lacks an adequate inventory.

After having attended a training meeting on managing inventory, she is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of corn, rice, sugar, and more. The profit from her business will enable her to help out her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of sugar

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana, who is a 23-year-old young woman, lives in the village Akhalterjola. She has a husband and mother-in-law, who gets retirement assistance from the local government. Her income is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Nana can't find a stable job in spite of her high education. With the help of her family members Nana is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of her family's income. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Nana wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of USD 700 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 10 sheep. After the sheep are grown, they will sell the lambs for a good price, and also will trade the wool. Nana and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and start a dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plates, cups, bowls, spoons, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
Mouniratou est une femme mariée vivant en couple avec ses 2 enfants à Lomé quartier Cassablanca, à l’âge de 25 ans, elle débute la commercialisation des mèches. Une activité qui l’a amenée dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure dont elle sort coiffeuse en 2010. 
Associant les deux activités, Mouniratou a des difficultés pour avoir du stock de matérielles en temps réel malgré quelle s’approvisionne 1 fois par semaine. Apres avoir suivi la formation faite par Assilassimé sur la gestion de la clientèle elle sollicite ce crédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock en mèche et autres produits de coiffure afin de les rendre disponible aux clients.
texts.en:
Mouniratou is a married woman living with her spouse and her two children in the Cassablanca district, in the city of Lomé. She is 25 years old and started off in the commerce of hair extensions. This business lead her to an apprenticeship in hair styling, thus she has been a hair dresser since 2010. 

With the two businesses together, Mouniratou is having some difficulties with inventory in real time despite resupplying herself once a week. After having completed her training provided by Assilassimé that addressed customer management, she is requesting this loan to be able to increase her inventory of hair extensions and other hair products in order to make them available to customers.

loans.use: to purchase 80 hair extensions and 18 weaves

loans.name: Siempre Kullaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE KULLAQUITAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sarha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, artesana en zampoñas, costura de mandiles, venta de queso, venta de accesorios de autos, venta de comida, venta de poleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sarha es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bañadores; da a conocer que este negocio lo viene trabajando hace diez años, decide emprenderlo al observar a su amiga y el amplio comercio del producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de bañadores por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias fronterizas Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el área de crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The microbank "Siempre Kullaquitas" will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Collpani. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors where Sra. Sarha is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association bring forward are varied; among them are woodworking shop, artisan in panpipes, sewing aprons, selling cheese, selling car accessories, selling food and selling T-shirts. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microbusiness where Sra. Sahra is a member. She indicates that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of an adviser from the institution that went to visit her at her home. She currently has a business selling bathing suits; she discloses that she came to working this business ten years ago. She decided to start it by observing her friend and the extensive trade of the product. 

The loan that she is now taking out is for the augmentation of capital (purchase of wholesale bathing suits) that she will acquire from the markets at the border of Boliva - Peru and later she will sell them in her stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives as a concubine and has four children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings, the extent of credit and the extent of health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale swimwear.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Anta, âgée de 48 ans, est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Cela va faire plus de 10 ans qu’elle s’active dans le commerce. Elle habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres du guichet  d’IMCEC qui se trouve dans cette localité. Elle vit chez elle et utilise son propre espace pour  ouvrir une petite boutique où elle a installé un réfrigérateur pour vendre de la glace, des crèmes, de l’eau mis en sachets. Et avec la chaleur qu’il fait dans cette partie du pays, c’est une activité qui marche beaucoup car les gens on toujours besoin de se rafraichir. Elle vient solliciter un crédit afin d’acheter des denrées alimentaires et revendre. La plupart de ses dépenses personnelles sont réalisées à partir  des bénéfices de l’activité. Elle épaule même son mari grâce à ses revenus qui sont régulier.
Puisqu’elle a de l’espace qui ne lui revient à aucunes charges, elle aimerait un jour diversifier son commerce et vendre des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
Ms. Anta, aged 48, is a married woman and a mother. It will be over ten years that she has been active in commerce. She lives in a village located a few kilometers from the IMCEC branch office in her town. She lives in her own place and used her own space to open a small shop, where she has installed a refrigerator for selling ice, ice cream, and water in pouches. Given the hot weather in this part of the country, her business is doing well, since people are always in need of refreshments.

Anta is here to requesting a loan to purchase some supplies for her sales. Most of her personal expenses are covered with the profits from her business. She even supports her husband, thanks to her regular income. Because of the unused space she has, she would like to diversify her commerce and sell grocery items.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for selling ice cream and water

loans.name: Diwani

texts.en:
Diwani works hard to support her family. Diwani is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Diwani has been in this business for 14 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Diwani would like to save enough to buy additional more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with 1 child. She buys polyurethane, package the charcoal and sells it to small businesses in the zone. 

She needs this loan to buy more charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her store of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her child, who attend school, so that she can guarantee a prosperous future

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married mother of four children, two of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Bahati has operated a cashew nut selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es:
Wilber  tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos pero únicamente sus padres dependen de él.
Wilber  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño su padre, ya que desde pequeño lo llevaba al lugar de trabajo, el comenta que al inicio solo observaba como su padre sembraba la milpa y desde entonces a él le gusto esa actividad, fue así como Wilber aprendió y dos hermanos se involucra, trabajan en un horario de las 6:00 AM a12:00 del mediodía.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar 6 sacos de abono y comprará un litro de veneno para regarlo a la hierba mala que el terreno tiene y también una bolsa de semilla. El espera en Dios sacar una buena cosecha.
 
Sus sueños son que Dios le de vida para poder seguir cultivando la tierra y cuando el decida formar su familia, tener como llevar el sostén al hogar.
texts.en:
Wilber is 35 years old and went as far as sixth grade in school. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings, but only his parents depend on him. 

Wilber has been engaged in agriculture since he was 10 years old. His father taught him this work at a young age, as from the time he was little he was taken to where his father was working. He says that in the beginning he only watched how his father planted the field, and since then he has liked that work. That was how Wilber learned and his two siblings got involved. They work from 6:00 a.m. to noon.

He needs this loan in order to buy six bags of fertilizer, a liter of herbicide for spraying the weeds on his land, and also a bag of seed. 

He hopes God will give him a good harvest. His dreams are that God gives him life so that he can continue cultivating the land, and that when he decides to start a family he will have the means to support his household.

loans.use: To buy 6 bags of fertilizer, a liter of herbicide to spray on the weeds on his land, and also a bag of seed.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur deuxième cycle dans le programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mary (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants (06 garçons et 01 fille). Elle est vendeuse de tubercules et d’ognon de production locale et autres féculents, qu’elle achète auprès de commerçants venus de diverses localités à l’occasion de marché hebdomadaire dans la commune.

 Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner pour 02 sacs d’ognon à 10 000 F CFA l’un, divers assaisonnements pour la revente au village.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of 2013. It is composed of women determined to change their living conditions. They are here in this regard to begin their second loan cycle in the program. They all live in she same village and maintain strong solidarity and mutual assistance among themselves. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and also rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Mary (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower in the group. She is 39 years old and a married mother of seven children (six boys and a girl). She is a vendor of tubers and onions, produced locally, and of other starches, which she purchases from merchants from various towns during the weekly market in her commune. 

With this loan, she intends to stock up with 2 sacks of onions at 10,000 francs CFA each, as well as various seasonings, to be resold in the village. 

The profits from her business will enable her to save money, as well as to increase her financial capacity.

loans.use: to stock up on onions and various seasonings to be resold in the village

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur deuxième cycle dans le programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Adama (en médaillon à l’extrême droite vers le bas), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant (04 garçons et 01 fille). Elle  s’active dans la vente de légumes frais qu’elle se procure au marché hebdomadaire de la commune pour la revente au village où elle tient une table à la maison. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 10 ans.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter en plus des légumes frais par carton, 03 paquets de thé vert et du sucre revendu par sachet de 100 F CFA.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer dans la scolarisation de ses enfants, elle compte aussi augmenter son épargne pour rendre son activité plus rentable dans le futur.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of 2013. It is composed of women determined to change their living conditions. They are here in this regard to begin their second loan cycle in the program. They all live in she same village and maintain strong solidarity and mutual assistance among themselves. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and also rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Adama (in the cameo at the far right) is the featured borrower in the group. She is 39 years old and a married mother of five children (four boys and a girl). She has been active in selling fresh vegetables, which she procures at the commune’s weekly market. She then resells the goods in the village, where she has a table at her house. She enjoys good experience in this domain for having done it for over ten years. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase more fresh vegetables by the box, 3 packets of green tea, and some sugar to be sold in pouches at 100 francs each. 

The profits from her business will enable her to do more to help her children’s education. She also plans on increasing her savings in order to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh vegetables by the box, 3 packets of green tea, and some sugar

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 52 years old. She is married and has five children.

Nelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has received and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 3 years and also earns income from farming vegetables.

Nelda aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
Ludith vive en el Distrito de Polvora, es viuda por lo que tiene que salir a trabajar para poder solventar sus gastos.

Se dedica a la actividad agrícola hace varios años. Su principal producto cultivado es el cacao.
Es una persona muy amable y emprendedora por lo cual no le importa estar desde muy temprano en su chacra para poder hacerle el mantenimiento respectivo y así poder obtener mayores ingresos.

Gracias a los prestamistas de Kiva, Ludith podrá comprar insumos para poder abonar sus cultivos y fertilizar el terreno, de esta manera aumentará la producción y lo venderá a un precio competitivo en el mercado; de esta manera hará realidad uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Ser la mejor productora de cacao de la Región”.
texts.en:
Ludith lives in the Polvora district. She is a widow, and because of this she has to go out to work in order to pay her expenses.

She has worked in agriculture for a number of years. Her principal cultivated product is cacao.

She is a very kind and entrepreneurial person, and so it doesn't bother her to be out in her fields at a very early hour in order to do the appropriate maintenance and thus be able to obtain greater income.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Ludith will be able to buy supplies to be able to apply compost to her crops and fertilize the land. In this way, she will increase her production and she will sell it at a competitive price in the market. In this way she will make a reality of one of her greatest dreams: to be the best producer of cacao in the region.

loans.use: to buy supplies to fertilize the land and apply compost to the crops

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 38 years old. He is a father of three children who all go to school. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Selem

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Selem. Selem lives together with her five children on a small piece of land in Eldoret, a rural town in Kenya with extremely fertile soil for agriculture. On the farm, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows maize. She makes a decent living selling milk, eggs and maize. She also holds a job that pays her a monthly salary. Despite all these activities, Selem still finds time and energy to engage in a small seasonal business to make extra money.

Selem is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She needs to increase her milk production to meet the demand. “My payments are always full payments made on time. I am very disciplined and good with money. I will not burn my bridges because I may still need to count on the very lenders in the future when I am doing further expansions,” Selem assured us.

With increased income, she will be more comfortable with her highest monthly expense--school fees. Selem's end game is to radically transform her family's lifestyle to a more improved state.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 54 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to retail.

Ernita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for 15 years and earns additional income from farming rice and fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Leonard, a smallholder farmer who lives together with his family in Kisii, a rural village neighboring land of the Maasai. On a small piece of land, the father of eight keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows tea, vegetables, and fruits. He has been doing this work for 34 years! His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, fruits, and food crops. He also makes extra money engaging in other seasonal businesses.

Leonard is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He takes deep pride in being a dairy farmer: “Dairy farmers enjoy self-support. We are independent. We live in beautiful surroundings with our animals.” Leonard’s unhurried lifestyle still gives him time to look after his animals as individuals.

Leonard finds farming to be fulfilling and lucrative: “Farming has been a good source of income!” However, his biggest challenge is poor roads leading to the market. This makes transportation very costly.  

With this loan, Leonard will make more money from his dairy sector due to increased milk production. This will enable him to pay, comfortably, his highest monthly expense – school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Leonard replied that it would improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes shop business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanajuma is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Afrodis

texts.en:
Afrodis is 28 years old. He is married and has spent four years in rice production. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 38-year-old female married Ugandan. She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda and is responsible for taking care of four children. She has got a retail business where she sells cement and other hardware materials. Her business is located in a rural area where the general public can access her. She started the business so as to earn a living and educate her children. Pamela hopes to expand her business. However, she is challenged with few customers. She wants a loan to buy cement and nails to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement and nails to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking single woman with children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in poultry as her main source of income though she has other side businesses like agriculture where she earns an extra income. She started this business to sustain herself and have a better standard of living. She faces a challenge of chicken diseases that affect her birds and sometimes they end up dying. She has a vision of owning a big modern poultry farm.

She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Barack

texts.en: Barack lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He has got a boutique business where he sells clothes commonly known as bitenge. Barack has been in business since 2000, when he started so as to get income to cater to the family's needs. His dream is to build rentals in order to have several sources of income. He is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in Vayots Dzor with her son. Zhanna's husband is currently working as a laborer outside of the country and tries to support his family financially. Zhanna herself has been working at a bakery. She makes Armenian bread and sells it locally. Zhanna is a very hardworking woman and the income that she gathers from bread making is very important for her family's living. Zhanna has applied for this loan to be able to purchase an oven and materials for making bread. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Zhanna and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for an oven and materials for making bread

loans.name: Dolores Elías

texts.es:
Dolores es un hombre muy trabajador de 45 años de edad, tiene tercer grado de nivel académico, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a lo domestico, tiene 2 hijas en este matrimonio de los cuales los 2   viven en casa, además de una hijastra y toda su familia depende de él.

Dolores se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad este trabajo se lo enseño el Papá  ya que el papá quería que ellos aprendieran este oficio y se los  enseño para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos  y él viaja a pie, y trabaja en un horario de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD.
 
El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar el abono para el cultivo, anteriormente alquiló terreno para el cultivo y ahora necesita comprar 5 sacos de abono.
