Sus sueños son que Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa ya que esta cosecha logrará tener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Dolores is a very hard-working 45 year old man who's married and has a third grade education. His wife is a homemaker and he has two daughters from this marriage, both of whom live at home, and also a stepdaughter. He supports his entire family. Dolores has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old, and learned the job from his dad. His dad wanted them to learn this trade, and taught it to them so they could use it to make a living in the future. The farm is 15 minutes away from home and he travels on foot, working from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM. The requested loan is necessary to purchase fertilizer for the crop. Previously, he rented land for growing the crop and now needs to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer. His dream is that God grant him life so he can keep working the soil and have a means to support his household since this harvest would provide him the necessary income to put food on the table.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the crop he needs to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Margoth

texts.es: Ana es madre soltera y tiene 19 años, Ana  vive con su madre y su abuelito, Ana tiene una hija de 2 años y esperando otro hijo ya que está embarazada, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, su aspiración es que a futuro cuando sus hijos ya tengan que asistir a la escuela ya pueda tener algo de dinero ahorrado para darles lo necesario.
texts.en: Ana is a single mother and is 19 years old. She lives with her mother and her grandfather. She has a two-year-old daughter and is expecting another child, since she is pregnant. She raises small animals. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow. Her goal is that in the future when her children have to go to school, she can already have some money saved to give them what is necessary.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Aziza, who is the mother of two grown children, is in her early fifties and divorced. She is living with her grandchild who is still in school. For two years now, Aziza has supported her family by running a shop selling dry food items, including maize flour, baking flour, sugar, and cooking oil, as well as soft drinks. She works from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to make a very small profit each month.

This is Aziza’s second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to replenish her shop with new inventory. Aziza used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to restock items in her shop. She dreams that one day she will be able to increase her shop’s capital. Aziza received a profit, which she used to cover school fees for her grandchild who is still in secondary school and also to pay for her household expenses. 

Aziza will share this loan with her loan group “Bega Kwa Bega,” which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new inventory.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Hello world, meet Rodah! She is a mother of four who lives together with her children on a small piece of land in Eldoret, Kenya. On the farm, she keeps poultry and dairy cows and also grows maize. She makes a decent living selling milk, eggs and maize and she also engages in other small personal businesses. Rodah spent years trying to access formal financial services to no avail. She was referred to Juhudi by a friend who went through the same trouble. Since joining Juhudi, she has had access to a low interest rate loan without even having a collateral; this enabled her to have some assets in her name. Today, Rodah is before you seeking another loan to purchase a dairy cow. She has the room and resources on her farm to sustain more dairy animals. With more milk, Rodah will be able to generate enough income to comfortably repay the loan and meet her high monthly family-related expenses. This loan will go a long way in improving Rodah's family's standard of living. She wants her children to grow up healthy and wise.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Dinah, a smallholder lady farmer who lives in Eldoret, Kenya. She is the mother of six children and has been practising agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling milk, eggs and tea produced from her farm. She likes milking the cow with her children in the morning and in the afternoon every single blessed day. Her passion extends to the point of naming her cow Lelkina. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Dinah has opted to take out a Kiva loan to purchase a dairy cow. As she says, "Kiva loans have a favourable repayment period and interest rate terms that favour small-scale farmers like me." The additional cow will increase Dinah's farm's milk output by more than 40%. This will translate to higher income to enable her to repay the loan on time with ease.

With your loan, Dinah will be able to comfortably meet her family expenses that take up most of her income. The loan will help Dinah’s family to elevate their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en:
Josianne is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is age 50. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business to enable him to acquire machines and tractors in the future that will enhance his farming capacity. 

As of 2009, the agriculture sector accounted for 37 percent of Rwanda’s gross domestic product, generated 65 percent of Rwanda’s export revenue, and employed approximately 90 percent of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Segundina lives in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, in the south of Peru. She is a respectful and unassuming person who works in agriculture and livestock raising. She has various plots of land where she plants barley, beans, potatoes, wheat, quinoa, kiwicha, and other crops. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Paccollos," and at this time she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is grateful to all the investors for the support offered, and she promises to make the established payments with great responsibility and on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Perus

texts.en:
Perus is aged 32 and the mother of two children. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase rice production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, roof tile, and cement, in order to build her house.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a married woman with three children. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to help her improve her beauty salon. Justine is facing the challenge of low business turnover due to limited products. Therefore, she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more equipment for the salon and more products like hair gels and hair relaxers to attract more customers and earn more income. This will help her to adequately meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy equipment and products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no quisieron mandarla a estudiar, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, María ha procreado 5 hijos, 4 de ellos viven y el otro ya formó su propia familia.

María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad esto se lo enseño el papá pues ella era muy pegada a él, luego niña María se acompañó y desde entonces ha trabajado en la agricultura con su pareja, además de dos hijos que se involucran en este trabajo y viajan a pie a una distancia de 10 minutos en un horario de las 6:00 AM a 11:00 AM.

El crédito solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar el abono y la semilla para que el cultivo sea de muy buena calidad y lo está preparando ya en las primeras tormentas que han caído esperando en Dios que sea un invierno muy bueno para que las cosechas sean abundantes y así los ingresos en la familia sean suficientes.

Sus mayores sueños son seguir trabajando para que sus hijos que están en la escuela sigan preparándose académicamente y sean buenos profesionales, que no se queden asi como sus padres que no quisieron mandarla a la escuela.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study since her parents did not want to send her to study. She is in a relationship and her husband makes a living from agriculture. Maria has had 5 children. 4 of them live with them and the other has already formed his own family.

Maria has made a living from agriculture since she was 15 years old. This was taught to her by her father since she was very close to him. Later, the young Maria entered in a relationship. Since then, she has worked in agriculture with her partner and two children. They are involved in this work and travel a distance of 10 minutes on foot on the schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan requested from CrediCampo is needed to purchase compost and seeds so that the crop is of very good quality. She is preparing it already in the first storms that have come. She hopes to God that it is a very good winter so that the harvests are abundant and the family’s income is sufficient.

Her greatest dreams are to continue working so that her children who are in school can continue to prepare themselves academically and be good professionals, and that they do not become like her parents who did not want to send her to school.

loans.use: to purchase compost and seeds so that the crop is of good quality.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Román, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y atiende un taller de estructuras metálicas, la agricultura es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y ha practicado todo el tiempo, también ofrece el servicio de albañilería, son estas actividades las que le permiten cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive con su compañera de vida y cinco hijos, tres de los cuales están estudiando.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, hierro, láminas, electrodos, pinturas, etc.,  preparara el terreno para cultivar y equipara el taller para seguir trabajando en los encargos de sus clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la situación familiar y cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Román grows basic grains and tends a workshop for metal structures. Agriculture is a trade that he learned from his father and has always practiced. He also offers masonry services. These are the businesses that allow him to cover the needs of his family. He lives with his life companion and five children, three of whom are in school.

He will invest in the purchase of compost, pesticides, seeds, iron, metal sheets, electrodes, paints, etc. He will prepare the land for crops and equip the workshop to continue working on the orders of his customers.

His goal is to improve his income in order to improve the family situation and pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, seeds, iron, metal sheets, electrodes, paint, etc.

loans.name: Martha Ximena

texts.es: Ximena tiene 25 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de una hija de 4 años que existe a la escuela, se dedica 2 años a la ganadería ya que su padre le inculca que este negocio es muy rentable, Ximena vive en la casa de su padre con él y con su hija, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para tenerlos en los terrenos de sus padre, esta señorita  espira incrementar su negocio para darle a su hija todo lo necesario para que estudie.
texts.en:
Ximena is 25 years old. She is a single mother of one 4-year-old daughter who is in school. 

She has made a living for 2 years from livestock since her father instilled in her that this business is very profitable. Ximena lives in her father’s home with him and her daughter. 

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of calves to have on her father’s land. This young woman aspires to grow her business to give everything necessary to her daughter so that she studies.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Mumias, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

George is married and has seven children. He is an extension officer. He also undertakes farming with his wife. They have been farming for seven years now and they are currently growing bananas, sugarcane, and trees on their farm. George is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is George's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. George's hope for the future is to invest in various businesses.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Wycliffe is married and has four children. He is a mason as well as a farmer. Both he and his wife have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize and soy beans as well as keeping dairy cattle and poultry in their farm. Wycliffe is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income, it will provide him with wax for making candles, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Wycliffe's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Wycliffe's hope for the future is to be able to provide for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Zenah is married and has six children. She is a leader of the Mother’s Union in her Church and she also undertakes farming with her husband. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, and bananas in their farm. Zenah is excited about beekeeping as it is an enterprise that does is not labor intensive.

This is Zenah’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Zenah’s hope for the future is to develop her farm and to see her children well educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Salome is married and has five children.  She is a church elder as well the treasurer in her church. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, and millet, and keeping livestock on their farm. Salome is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey which she believes is good for her health.

This is Salome’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her grandchildren. Salome’s hope for the future is to live a peaceful life in her old age.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Rhoda is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize and keeping livestock in their farm. Rhoda is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Rhoda’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to develop a piece of land that she owns. Rhoda’s hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Pauline is married and has three children. She runs a small kiosk and also undertakes farming with her husband. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize and beans and keeping livestock in their farm. Pauline is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food. 

This is Pauline’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy more livestock to boost her farm projects. Pauline’s hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Prisca

Prisca is married and has one child. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for fourteen years now and they are currently growing maize and vegetables in their farm. Prisca is excited about beekeeping as it is an enterprise that is easy to manage.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka lives in Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Milka is married and has seven children. She is a Church elder and she undertakes farming with her husband, as well. They have been farming for 51 years and they are currently growing maize and bananas on their farm. Milka is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Milka's first loan from Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her grandchildren's needs and to save up for her old age. Milka's hope for the future is to live a peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Waridi Pendo Group

texts.en:
Amina is aged in her early thirties and has two kids who are at school. Amina, who is single, supports her family's living with a mamalishe (small restaurant) business. She has been working in this category for five years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Her business is open from 5 AM to midnight. 

Amina is requesting a seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to grow her business service by adding a new food service (selling chicken soup) and extending her food service to midnight. Before, Amina was operating her business up to noon time because her business capital was small and did not enable Amina to meet all demanded food items. 

She is so thankful for Kiva's loan support. Amina earned a profit which she used to buy a home cupboard and TV and to pay school fees and home food expenses. She will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients for her mamalishe. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Waridi Pendo, which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 32 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizers as during rice production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, Jean Pierre wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machinery and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon lives in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a transportation business in addition to cutting grass to earn income to cater for his family's needs. Simon used his previous loan to buy a mowing machine and now intends to use this loan to buy land for farming. His dream is to pay for his children's education; however, his challenge is finding customers.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Divina, a mother who lives with her two children on a small piece of land in Kitale, Kenya. She sells milk and maize from her farm for a living. She has been doing this for the past four years. Recently, she started offering transportation services using her motorcycle to fellow farmers who had challenges transporting their produce to the market. Divina also holds a job that pays her a monthly salary.
 
Making profits after all the hard work that goes into farming is the part she enjoys most. Milking dairy cows is her hobby. However, Divina and other farmers in her area constantly worry about pests, diseases, and drought. 

Divina is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Increased milk production will help her meet the ever-increasing demand. With your assistance, she will realize more profits from her farming activities. The additional income will offset some of her farming-related expenses that give her sleepless nights. As she said, "My children will be very excited about the luxury of an improved diet too!"

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fanny Mercedes

texts.es:
Todas las tardes, tras haber terminado de leer un libro sobre su escritor favorito, Fanny inicia a preparar la clase de Lengua y Literatura del día siguiente, su meta es presentar cada tema de manera dinámica para que sus alumnos capten la idea y aprendan. Es una joven emprendedora e inteligente, tiene 27 años, está soltera y cursa el último año de su carrera, Educación con énfasis en Lengua y Literatura. Ella agradece el apoyo de su madre y hermano mayor, quienes día a día la motivan y apoyan a seguir un buen camino.
Ella solicita el crédito para el financiamiento de su título universitario, deposita su confianza en el crédito puesto que cumplirá uno de sus más grandes sueños, la culminación de su carrera. Un título le ayudará a obtener más propuestas de trabajo, agradece en el que labora actualmente en el que ha obtenido un gran aprendizaje, pero anhela ampliar sus horizontes. Quiere ser una mujer de éxito y de orgullo para su familia, uno de sus planes futuros es obtener una maestría especializada en su carrera, es decir seguir creciendo profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Every afternoon, after having finished reading a book by her favorite author, Fanny begins to prepare for the Language and Literature class for the following day. Her goal is to present every topic in a dynamic way so that her students capture the idea and learn. She is an entrepreneurial and intelligent young woman. She is 27 years old. She is single and is studying in the last year of her program, education with emphasis in language and literature. She is grateful for the support of her mother and older brother, who every day motivate her and encourage her to continue on a good path.

She is applying for the loan to pay for her university degree. She is placing her confidence in the loan, since this will complete one of her greatest dreams, the completion of her program. A degree will help her to obtain more proposals for work. She appreciates the work she has now, in which she has obtained substantial training, but she wishes to expand her horizons. She wants to be a successful woman and a source of pride for her family. One of her plans for the future is to obtain a master's degree specializing in her program, that is to say, to continue growing professionally.

loans.use: to pay for her university degree

loans.name: Jeniva

texts.en:
Jeniva lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Jeniva is married and has ten children. She is a landlord as well as a treasurer in her church. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, bananas, and sugarcane on their farm. Jeniva is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Jeniva's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children through high school. Jeniva's hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Elizabeth

Elizabeth is single and has six children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty years now, and she is currently growing maize, beans, and woodcock, as well as keeping livestock on her farm. Elizabeth is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey, and the bees will aid in pollinating her crops. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and to invest in her farming. Elizabeth’s hope for the future is to invest in projects that are not labor intensive and to put up a tourist hotel on her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale County. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Stellah is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes and vegetables in their farm. Stellah is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Stellah’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to start a small business. Stellah’s hope for the future is to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machinery and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

loans.name: Flores De Chontola Group

texts.en:
Chontala is located in a rural area of Chichicastenango, in Guatemala. This fertile area supports a thriving agricultural community where fruit like plums, peaches and apples are grown. Many also work in textile production. Some time ago, a group of ten women organized a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Flores de Chontala” or “Flowers of Chontala”. Their goal is to expand their businesses, acquire knowledge, empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge, which combines small loans and education, is a wonderful and effective way for them to achieve these goals.

The President of the Trust Bank is Herminia. She is a formidable woman with one year of formal education and eight children. She has a tamale business and her entire family participates in the preparation and sale of this delicious and typical Guatemalan dish. Herminia and her children sell tamales each weekend in their community. Because of the success of the business, she added more items to the menu, including a corn drink called “atole”, and “tostadas” which are tortillas topped with black beans, salsa and guacamole. At the same time, Herminia has a traditional textile business. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase ingredients for her tamale business as well as thread and supplies for her textile business.

Doña Herminia is quite pleased and happy because she has been able to watch her four youngest children not only complete primary school but also to attend higher educational institutions. She knows that education is a vital key to a more successful future. Her fellow Trust Bank members also realize this and are eager to participate in the monthly educational seminars given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. The women learn about relevant subjects which they immediately apply to their small businesses. Some topics include budgeting, accounting, customer service and indebtedness. Other themes are self esteem and women’s rights, health and hygiene as well as nutrition.

The “Flores de Chontala” Trust Bank extends gratitude to KIVA investors for supporting their goals and dreams. They are committed to a more prosperous future. We look forward to reporting on their progress! Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her tamale business as well as thread for her textile business.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a 35-year-old married man with two children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in computer and stationery services. Edson ventured into this business so he could employ himself. He faces the challenges of high electricity bills and load shedding. However, he has a vision of expanding his business and opening new outlets. Edson needs a loan to buy a photocopier.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, etc. to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Restauratrice de pâte fermentée appelée Kom en langue locale depuis 1972,  julienne en 2012 pour des raisons médicales abandonne cette activité pour commercialiser les produits plastiques. La veuve âgée de 64 ans elle a la charge de ses 2 enfants. Logée gratuitement dans une maison  familiale sise dans le quartier Gbossimé a Lomé, Julienne exploite la devanture de la maison pour son activité. 
Chaque occasion de crédit reçu est une opportunité pour Julienne d’augmenter son stock de produits et pour cette troisième demande elle achètera des bassines, des sceaux et assiettes.
texts.en:
A restauranteur in 1972 offering fermented cornmeal called “kom” in the local language, Julienne abandoned this business in 2012 due to medical reasons in order to sell plasticware. She is a widow, 54 years old, and she has two children to support. Staying rent-free in a family house located in the Gbossimé district of Lomé, Julienne makes use of the entry way to her house for her business. 

Each opportunity to obtain a loan is an opportunity for Julienne to increase her stock of products. For this third loan, she will purchase some tubs, buckets, and plates.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tubs, buckets, and plates

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County, located in Western Kenya and famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Simon is married and has eight children. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirty years. They are currently growing maize and tea on their farm, and also keep dairy cows. Simon is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Simon's first loan from Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a business. Simon's hope for the future is to do well in his farming.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena es una señora de 44 años de edad, tiene 4 hijas de las cuales una asiste a la escuela, otra al colegio y las dos ya son mayores de edad y una de ellas tiene una hija de 2 años, Elena vive en la casa de su madre con ella, sus 4 hijas y una nieta, Elena comenta que se dedica 3 años a la crianza de ganado y que empezó cuando Fodemi le otorgo el primer crédito, con el dinero de este crédito va a comprar una vaca para incrementar su actividad y para mejorar sus ingresos y darles la mantención a sus familia y el estudio a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Señora Elena is 44 years old, and she has four daughters. One is in grade school, and another is in high school; two are already grown up, and one of these has a two-year-old daughter. Elena lives in her mother’s house with her mother, her four daughters, and a grandchild. 

She says that she has been raising livestock for three years, and that she began when FODEMI gave her the first loan.  With the money from this loan she will purchase a cow, in order to expand her business and improve her earnings, so that she can provide for her family and for the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: "soppe Dabakh Malick Parcelle" Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de crédit appelé « Soppe Dabakh Malick »  du nom d’un grand marabout décédé, rassemble des femmes qui ont des liens de parenté. Elles veulent un financement pour améliorer chacune son activité. Leur présidente, la dame Adama qui se trouve au milieu sur la photo, s’active dans le commerce d’huile de palme et de citron, elle fait cela depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle est très active car c’est elle qui va jusqu’en Casamance  pour chercher la marchandise, elle en profite pour voir les parents et leur remettre un peu d’argent. Elle appuie aussi son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Adama possède une clientèle fidèle à cause de la qualité de ses produits, elle aimerait si elle a les moyens, augmenter la quantité qu’elle ramène pour mieux satisfaire la demande.
texts.en:
This loan group is called “ Soppe Dabakh Malick” after the name of a deceased holy man. It is composed of women linked by kinship. The women want financing to improve each of their businesses. Their president, Ms. Adama, is in the middle of the photo. She has been active in selling palm oil and limes for over ten years. She is a married mother of a family, and so she is very active, since she is the one who goes to Casamance to find merchandise. She takes advantage of seeing her parents there and leaves them a little money. She also supports her husband in covering household expenses. 

Adama has a loyal customer base due to the quality of her products. If she had the means, she would like to  increase the amount of goods she brings back in order to meet the demand.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as palm oil, limes, and peanut butter, to resell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco in southern Peru. She is a respectful and honest person who is engaged in agriculture and livestock-raising. She has several pieces of farmland where she grows barley, lima beans, potatoes, wheat, quinoa, amaranth and other crops.

She belongs to the "Los Paccollos" communal bank, and on this occasion needs the loan in order to buy seed and fertilizer. She is grateful to all the investors for the support provided and promises to make her scheduled payments very responsibly and on time.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of soap, spray etc. to sell

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mugabushaka est une commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Naboti », entrepreneur, âgée de 60 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants, tous scolarisés. La cliente est une vendeuse d’haricots. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint est un cultivateur. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Our client Mugabushaka is a vendor belonging to the Naboti business group. She is 60 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, all of whom study. She sells bean. She displays her wares at one of the town markets. She launched her business with the funds received from Hekima. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in business for six years. This new loan will allow her to buy six bags of beans. Her goal is to increase her capital, build a house, and provide for the education, clothing and food of her children. Finally, she sincerely thanks Hekima for allowing female entrepreneurs without access to traditional banking become financially independent, especially at this difficult time following armed conflicts in the east of the country. Please note that, in the photo, one of the clients is pictured holding her child.

loans.use: to buy three bags of beans.

loans.name: Tuimizane Bus Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kaeni est une commerçante depuis 13 ans, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Tuimizane Bus», entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse  souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 70 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire dans une usine de la place. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kaeni, has been a merchant for thirteen years and is the president and a member of the business collective “Tuimizane Bus”. An entrepreneur, she is 52 years old and the married mother of nine children, all students. She is a vendor of secondhand shoes and has a stall for her business at her town’s central market, 

Kaeni is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 70 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a staff member at a local factory. She started off with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children.

She thanks Hekima for choosing the right goal of supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system while according them loans without the need for collateral, especially during this time post-conflict in the country’s eastern region.

loans.use: to purchase 70 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Dzidula Avepozo Group

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans Amavi est née à Lomé dans le quartier Avépozo où il réside actuellement avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants. Elle fait parti du groupe DZIDULA AVEPOZO.
A 26 ans elle travaillait comme employée dans une boutique de vente de ciment, activité qu’elle abandonna suite à un voyage de longue période. En 2002, elle se lance pour son compte dans la vente des produits divers dans sa boutique à domicile.
Après avoir été informée de la présence de l’équipe d’Assilassimé dans leur quartier et suivi la formation sur la séparation des deux budgets, Amavi sollicite du crédit pour acheter 1 sac de maïs et charbon de bois et 1 carton de tomate conditionnée pour autonomiser son budget.
Divers produits tels que des tapettes, mèches, produits alimentaires, des pagnes,  des serviettes, des fruits, légumes et autres sont commercialisés par les membres du groupe d’Amavi. Pour renforcer leur stock et dégager un bénéfice leur permettant de couvrir leurs besoins.
texts.en:
Amavi, aged 41, was born in Lomé, in the Avépozo district, where she currently resides with her [husband] and five children. She is part of the group DZIDULA AVEPOZO. At the age of 26, she used to be an employee in a store selling cement. It was work she abandoned after a long period of travel. In 2002, she got started on her own selling a variety of products in a shop in her home. 

After having been informed of the presence of the Assilassimé team in the district, and after having attended training on how to separate budgets, Amavi is requesting a loan to purchase a sack of corn, some charcoal, and a box of packaged tomatoes in order to empower her budget.


Various products, such as flip flops, hair extensions, grocery items, ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), plates, fruit & vegetables, and more are sold by the members of Amavi’s group. To bolster their stock of products and to make a profit enabling them to meet their needs, [the group members are requesting a loan].

loans.use: to purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Alvaro Fernando

texts.es: Alvaro es un señor colombiano, comenta que en Colombia es escaso el trabajo  y en ocasiones mal pagado,  se vino a Ecuador hace 4 años en busca de trabajo, el tiene 25 años de edad y tiene una hija de 2 años, Álvaro se dedica 10 años a la ganadería  y al trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona para ponerla en la hacienda donde trabaja de mayordomo ya que el dueño de dicha hacienda le permite que ponga en sus terrenos 3 cabezas de ganado para que se ayude en sus ingresos, Alvaro comenta que  vive en una casa de la hacienda y que ahí ni siquiera tiene luz, la aspiración de Alvaro es poder incrementar su negocio y comprar una casa para mejorar su calidad de vida y llevarle a vivir son el a la madre de su hija y la niña.
texts.en:
Alvaro is Colombian and says that in Colombia work is scarce and sometimes badly paid. He came to Ecuador four years ago in search of work. He is 25 and has a two-year-old daughter. Alvaro has been engaged in farm work and livestock-raising for 10 years. 

He is going to use the loan to purchase an adult dairy cow to keep at the farm where he works as a manager, since the owner of the farm allows him to graze three head of cattle on his land, to help him earn income.  

Alvaro says that he lives in a house on the farm and does not even have electricity there. Alvaro's ambition is to be able to expand his business and buy a house, so that he can improve his quality of life and and bring the mother of his daughter and his daughter to live with him.

loans.use: To buy an adult dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Ruben

texts.es: Carlos es un joven muy trabajador tiene 36 años de edad, el es casado y tiene un hijo de 9 años y se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Carlos se dedica a la  compra y venta de caña los fines de semana y también provee este producto a otros vendedores ambulantes de caña,  en el transcurso de la semana trabaja de estibador de carga en el mercado y también se dedica a  la agricultura,  su esposa también trabaja de estibadora, Carlos  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de caña para incrementar su mercadería,  su aspiración es que mediante su trabajo pueda reunir dinero para arreglar su pequeña casa.
texts.en: Carlos, 36, is a hardworking young man.  He is married and has a nine year old son who attends school.  Carlos buys and sells sugar cane on the weekends and also provides this product to other sugar cane street vendors.  In the course of the week, he is a stevedore at the market, and is also engaged in farming.  His wife also works as a stevedore.  Carlos is going to invest the loan in the purchase of sugar cane to increase his merchandise.  Through his work, he hopes to raise money to repair his small home.

loans.use: to purchase sugar cane.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the Paucartambo area of the province of Cusco, in the south of Peru.

She is a friendly and simple person who works in agriculture. She has several plots of land where she has planted barley, beans, potatoes, wheat, quinoa, amaranth and other crops.

She belongs to the "Los Paccollos" community bank  and needs a loan to buy seeds. 

She thanks all the investors for their support and promises to pay the scheduled installments back with responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Solange est une commerçante depuis 8 ans, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Tuimizane», entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse  souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 25 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
This client, Solange, has been a merchant for eight years and is the president and a member of the business collective “Tuimizane”. An entrepreneur, she is 35 years old and the married mother of five children, all students. She is a vendor of secondhand shoes. She has a stall for her business at the town’s central market, 

Solange is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 25 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a driver. She started off with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to build [a house] and provide schooling and food for her children.

She thanks Hekima for choosing the right goal of supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system while according them loans without the need for collateral, especially during this time post-conflict in the country’s eastern region.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 44 years old, and is married with three young children. He owns a house and works in an auto repair shop that he started more than 20 years ago. Mario is asking for a loan to buy a hydraulic jack and other tools for his business.

Mario says that most of his clients are taxi and public transportation drivers. He has many recurring clients. Mario gives credit to his father, who taught him from a very young age to have a solid work ethic and assume responsibility.

Mario says that his biggest accomplishment is providing stability for his family and his goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic jack and other tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Elévation Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyembwe est une commerçante depuis 4 ans, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires  «Elévation», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, 2 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers manufacturés. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est agent dans une organisation de la société civile. Elle va  acheter, savons de toilette, des cartons de bombons, des biscuits,sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir, elle compte achever sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent aussi leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Nyembwe, has been a merchant for four years and is the president and a member of the business association “Elévation”. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 38 years old and the married mother of four children, of whom two are students, and two are still kids. She is a vendor of a variety of manufactured goods. 

Nyembwe is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She started with funds from her husband, who is a representative of a private company. She is going to purchase bath soaps, boxes of candy, cookies, sugar, rice, oils, soap powder, cosmetics, a box of notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc. For the future, she plans on having her own house and providing schooling and food for her children, as well as ensuring their medical care. 


So, she thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be noted that some of the clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase bath soaps, candy, cookies, sugar, rice, oils, soap powder, cosmetics, notebooks, pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: Asunta vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Asunta lives in the province of Paucartambo in the Cusco region of southern Peru.  She is a respectful, straightforward person who farms and raises livestock.  She has several fields where she grows barley, beans, potatoes, wheat, quinoa, amaranth, and other things.  Asunta belongs to the Los Paccollos Communal Bank and on this occasion she needs a loan to buy seeds.  She thanks all the lenders for their support and is committed to making her loan payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Amanda Rubiela

texts.es: Amanda está separada  de su esposo, tiene 3 hijos, uno  de 5 años que va a la escuela, una hija de 2 años y la hija de 16 años que vive con su padre, Amanda se dedica a La crianza de chanchos y al jornal en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en un lugar donde paga arriendo para criar sus chanchos, Amanda anhela poder darles la educación a sus hijos mediante los ingresos de su negocio de chanchos.
texts.en:
Amanda is separated from her husband. She has three children—a five-year-old who goes to school, a two-year-old daughter, and a 16-year-old daughter who lives with her father.  Amanda raises pigs, and works as a day-laborer in the fields. 

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, in order to put them in the rented location where she raises them. With the earnings from her pig business, Amanda wants to give her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $1,000 helped Ala to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Ella es Amalia, una muchacha llena de virtudes, encantadora, echada pa’lante, decidió formar un hogar de donde hubo un hijo: lo mejor que le puede suceder a una familia, empezó a laborar en una clínica donde se enamoró del trabajo y de todo lo que hacía a diario, cada día aprendía algo nuevo y conocía a alguien que le dejara una enseñanza o un consejo, entonces decidió que quería aprender más y capacitarse, empezó un curso en el Sena pero el destino y la vida le jugó una mala pasada, el Esposo  había fallecido, tuvo un Accidente de Moto, los ánimos bajaron y la situación económica también, era algo muy difícil para ella y el pequeño hijo de tan solo 6 años, entonces no pudo continuar con los estudios, Pero ahora luego de un tiempo de recuperarse  ha decidido que quiere comenzar de nuevo, que quiere ser la mejor profesional y capacitarse cada día mas para brindarle un futuro brillante  a el  hijo, para crecer como persona, para tener una estabilidad laboral con las mejores condiciones. 
Por eso ella desea contar con un apoyo para seguir Estudiando en Administración en Salud   y así  lograr todos los objetivo y metas propuestas  con el pequeño, ella tiene que responsabilizarse de todos los gastos con el hijo sola y  no tiene con quien contar, pero hace un gran esfuerzo con las ventas por catálogo y los trabajos informales, pero aun así le es complicado pagar todo, es por eso que ella solicita el convenio de kiva ya que como menciono antes los gastos que tiene son bastantes y no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar el valor de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Amalia is a charming young girl full of virtues.   Ready to go for it, she decided to make a home where she had a child, the best thing that can happen to a family.  She started working in a clinic where she fell in love with the work. She learned something new every day from all the work that she did, and met someone who gave her an education and advice.  The she decided that she wanted to learn more and train herself.  She began a course in El Sena, but destiny and life played a trick on her.  Her husband died in a motorcycle accident.  Her spirits declined as well as her financial situation.  It was very difficult for her and her small child, only six years old.  At that time, she couldn’t continue her studies.  But now, after a period of recovery, she has decided that she wants to begin again.  She wants to be a better professional and train herself more each day in order to offer her child a bright future so that he grows as a person, and has steady work with better living conditions.

For this reason, she wishes to have support to continue studying health administration, and thus achieve all of her proposed goals and objectives.  She alone has to take responsibility for all of her child’s expenses, and has no one else to count on.  However, she makes a great effort with her catalog sales and informal jobs.  But still, paying for everything is complicated.  She is requesting an agreement with Kiva because, as she mentioned before, she has quite a lot of expenses, and doesn’t have enough money to make the payments.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
La dame Mariama, âgée de 57 ans, mariée et mère de famille, est une brave femme qui s’active toujours pour mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions de vie. Elle vend des produits d’aloès Vera depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a adhéré depuis que ce produit a été amené au Sénégal : car il s’agissait de donner une somme pour pouvoir bénéficier des produits de cette gamme destinés à la commercialisation. Mariama désirant renouveler les produits, sollicite ce crédit à l’IMCEC. C’est une large gamme de médicaments et autres produits de beauté qui ont beaucoup de vertu. La vente se fait rapidement et en général, les clients font la commande avant.
Mariama appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison grâce aux revenus de son activité.
Elle désire diversifier son activité en y rajoutant la vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariama, aged 57, is a married mother of a family. She is a good and honest woman who has always been active providing the best living conditions for her children. She has been selling aloe products for over five years. She participated in it since this product was brought to Senegal: the situation is that you have to pay a premium in order to benefit from selling this range of product. 

Wishing to renew her products, Mariama is requesting this loan from IMCEC. This is a wide range of medications and other beauty products which have many desirable characteristics. Her sales are quick in general with her customers placing orders in advance. Mariama supports her husband in covering household expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. She would like to diversify her business by including the sale of cosmetic products.

loans.use: to purchase aloe products to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like coffee, shampoo, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested a new loan to further build her business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like coffee, shampoo, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa es un joven e 27 años de edad, la cual vive en la calurosa y alegre ciudad de Pucallpa, para poder sacar adelante a su pequeña de 3 años de edad, trabaja como secretaria en una institución educativa de su ciudad, desde hace algunos meses.

Rosa esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva por brindarle su confianza por segunda vez ya que en esta oportunidad seguira realizando mejoras en la vivienda donde habita y poder comprar enseres para su hogar y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young 27-year-old woman who lives in the hot and happy city of Pucallpa. In order to raise her three-year-old daughter, she has worked as a secretary in an educational institution in the city for a few months. 

Rosa is thankful to the Kiva investors for having confidence in her for the second time. She will continue improving the house when she lives,  buy utensils for her it, and realize her dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to improver her home and to buy utensils for it.

loans.name: Sixto Sergio

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos que ya no viven en casa pues han formado sus propios  hogares.  En casa del Sixto solo viven 2 nietos quienes estudian. 

Sixto se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 23 años de dedicarse a la siembra de maíz y frijol. El aprendió la agricultura por su padre quien desde muy pequeño le enseñó. Antes de dedicarse a eso don Sixto fue obrero, en la ciudad trabajó en la albañilería durante 16 años  luego mejor se dedicó a la agricultura. El trabajo donde cultiva Sixto está cerca de su casa y realiza una jornada de 6 horas diarias.

El crédito que él solicita lo necesita para comprar una vaca, la cual le servirá de mucho porque aprovechara los residuos de la agricultura para su alimentación y también le proveerá leche.

A él le gustaría comprar  más ganado pues actualmente no tiene  le gustaría tener para aprovechar el trabajo de la agricultura  y tener mejores ingresos de la venta de leche y queso. Para su familia desea  que ellos estén bien y que cumplan sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sixto is 63 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school. Currently, he is married and his wife works at home. He has 5 children who no longer live in his house as the have their own homes. 2 grandchildren who are studying live in Sixto's house. 

Sixto works in agriculture. He has been cultivating corn and beans for 23 years. He learned about agriculture from his father who taught him about it when he was very small. Before working in agriculture, he was a day laborer in the city working in construction for 16 years. Then, he worked in agriculture. The land that Sixto farms is near his house and he works for 6 hours per day. 

He needs this loan to buy a cow, which will help him a lot because it will eat agricultural waste and it will provide milk.He would like to buy more cows since he currently doesn't have any. He would like to improve his farm and increase his income through the sale of milk and cheese. For his family, he hopes that they are happy and reach their goals.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ceiling wooden supporting polls.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 52 years old. She is a mother of three, and they all go to school. 

She would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock machine, coverstitch machine, tabletop sewing machine, and to remodel her shop.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his education costs.

loans.name: Yaritza Marinel

texts.es: Yaritza de 19 años de edad es la propietaria de una sala de belleza, desde hace 4 años, cuando después de su experiencia familiar en esta actividad se dedicó a los servicios de estética y belleza. Siguiendo los pasos de su madre y su tía, y agregó una peluquería, donde ofrece servicios de Peinado, tinturado, corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure, y servicios generales de SPA. Para alcanzar nuevos clientes Yaritza promociona mediante medios publicitarios, desde su punto de ventas  y mediante campañas externas.  Su meta es modernizar su equipo de trabajo y poner en funcionamiento la sala de spa con todo su potencial, para más adelante tener su propia casa. Su mayor desafío es tener una vida crediticia activa y mediante estos financiamientos lo va a lograr poco a poco. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina y equipos de peluquería, como secador, planchas, camillas, y herramientas varias, con las cuales prestará un mejor servicio a su clientela para hacer de su credikiva una inversión productiva.
texts.en: Yaritza is 19 and has been the proprietor of a beauty salon for four years.  She began working in the beauty industry after getting experience with her family, following in the footsteps of her mother and her aunt.  She added a hair salon where she offers styling, coloring, haircuts, manicure, pedicure, and general spa services.  To reach new customers, Yaritza advertises in advertising media, at her salon, and via out-of-home ad campaigns.  Her goal is to modernize her work equipment and bring the spa up to its full potential so that she can have her own house in the future.  Her biggest challenge is to have active credit and with these loans she can gradually achieve it.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a machine and equipment for styling hair such as a dryer, straighteners, salon beds, and various tools. With these she can provide better services for her clientele and make her Kiva loan a productive investment.

loans.use: to buy equipment for styling hair such as a dryer, straighteners, salon beds, and various tools

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco, a Mexican dairy producer, is passionate about new technologies, especially when they help him reduce costs while concurrently helping reduce his farm's environmental footprint. With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa, he'll be able to treat cow manure to generate renewable-methane rich biogas and a potent biofertilizer. The biogas will help him decrease the amount he spends on non-renewable propane - the fuel his family currently uses for cooking and heating bathwater. The biofertilizer will help him improve crop yields without having to spend more on petrochemical fertilizers. Reducing dependence on both of these fossil-fuel derived inputs will help Francisco save money and the environment. This loan represents 42% of the total cost of his Biobolsa and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an environmentally-friendly biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dressmaking.  Marivic is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchse additional sacks of feed.

Leonora has been pig fattening for 23 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruit.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchse additional sacks of feed

loans.name: José Juan

texts.en: José Juan and his wife believe in teaching their kids about sustainability. They rightfully believe that our future depends on reducing the waste we generate. The 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa they are investing meshes perfectly with their vision. Using the system, they will be able to transform cow manure into biofuel - methane-rich biogas - to displace the propane they currently use to cook and heat bathwater. They will also obtain a potent biofertilizer, allowing them to improve crop yields without spending on expensive, environmentally-damaging chemical fertilizers. Their kids will grow up knowing that it's perfectly normal to convert dung into energy and fertilizer. This loan represents 42% of the total cost of their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 07 Mai 2009 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui viennent d’entamer leur neuvième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 33 ans et mère de six enfants : trois garçons et trois filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d’arachide. Pour ce faire, elle achète le sac d’arachide à un prix moyen de 10 000 C CFA et fait la transformation pour la vente par seaux de 20 et 5 Kg.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  au moins 08 sacs de 50 Kg pour la transformation et la vente.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales plus particulièrement dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on May 7, 2009 at the inauguration of the ’banc villageois’, this group is composed of women who are here to start their ninth loan cycle in the ’banc villageois’ program. The women are all from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Fatoumata (sitting at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 33 years old, and the mother of six: three boys and three girls. She is active in selling peanut butter. To do so, she purchases sacks of peanuts at an average price of 10,000 francs CFA and then processes them for sale by the 20 kg or 5 kg pail.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase at least 8 sacks at 50 kg each for processing and then resale.

With the profits. she plans on supporting her husband in managing family expenses, particularly the children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to process and then sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
