As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anelin

texts.es: Anelin vende accesorios para motocicletas desde hace 2 años; cuando emprendio su negocio, aprovechando el conocimiento de su cónyuge en estos vehiculos y el hecho de tener un dinero que con mucho esfuerzo habian ahorrado. Ella y su esposo decididos, dieron apertura a su almacen en el año 2012 y hasta la presente sus metas de crecimiento no se detienen,  pues sueñan con abrir 2 nuevas sucursales.  En su oferta de productos sus clientes prefieren los cascos, chalecos, y en general accesorios para motocicletas . Sus ventas son realizadas en un local durante todos los dias, de lunes a sabados, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, entre sus clientes que son trabajadores de empresas de mensajerias, conductores que ofrecen servicios de transporte en motos y todos los que son propietarios de este vehiculo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cascos, chalecos, materiales para elaboración de articulos de lujo etc.Con esta inversión  aumentará el surtido de sus productos y su negocio mejorará.
texts.en:
Anelin has been selling accessories for motorcyclists for two years. She launched her business at that time, taking advantage of her partner's knowledge of these vehicles and the fact that she had a sum of money that she had saved with a great deal of effort. 

She and her husband, determined, opened their store in 2012 and so far they haven't stopped setting goals for growth, as they dream of opening two new branches.

In their selection of products their customers prefer the helmets, vests, and in general, accessories for motorcyclists. Their sales are made at a sales outlet, every day from Monday to Saturday, from nine in the morning to seven in the evening. Their customers are people who work for messenger companies, drivers who offer mototaxi services, and all those who own these vehicles.

Currently she is applying for a credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy helmets, vests, materials for making custom-made articles, etc. With this investment she will increase the stock of her products and her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy helmets, vests, and materials for making custom-made articles.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 67 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Felomina has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After a 6 month loan period, Ni Ketut and the Babi Rahayu group managed to pay off the loan. From the sales of piglets, Ni Ketut managed a profit of 250.000 IDR per month. This result is far from the previous expectation where Ni Ketut was hoping to make 400.000 IDR per month.
High feed prices and the low selling price for pork were the main factors that caused the drop in expected profits. But this did not dampen the spirit Ni Ketut to run her business. Ni Ketut along with other members of the group will return to borrow capital to shore up their businesses.
Ni Ketut has great hope for a better profit so as to assist her in improving the welfare of her family.
As a housewife who lives in the village, Ni Ketut is qualified to pursue the pig business. In order to help her husband to fulfill her family needs, Ni Ketut came back to MUK to borrow 1.500.000 IDR for her capital. Together with the Babi Rahayu group, Ni Ketut plans to use this loan to buy super quality feed for her piglets and sow.
Ni Ketut expects in the next 6 months that the price per kilo of pig will be rising while feed prices will be declining so that her profits will be better than the previous period.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase larger quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

To be able to expand more her inventory she is requesting another Php12,000.00. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to increase her product inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marie dreams of a better and healthier living for her four children. She also hopes that her business will continue to expand. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to stock her variety store.

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Орзугул. Ей 41лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 25  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Она так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Орзугул запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who always tries to improve her living conditions and hopes for a brighter future, needs financial support. Her name is Orzugul. She is 41 years old. She is married and raising 4 children. Because she lives in a rural area, she has a good opportunity to develop her animal husbandry business. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 25 years and has a lot of experience in this business field. She takes such good care of her livestock that it almost seems that she understands the language of the livestock. Thanks to the livestock's good condition, she has regular clients. She wants to develop her business and earn more income. She plans to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions. Orzugul is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy livestock in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.ru:
Иванна живет и работает в Бориславе. Она уже получала финансовую помощь от КИВА, которая содействовала развитию ее бизнеса и помогла ей реализовать приобретенный тогда товар, получив планируемую прибыль. Со времени получения помощи от КИВА дети Иванны тоже смогли трудоустроиться, что теперь является существенной помощью для бюджета всей семьи. 
В этот раз Иванне нужна сумма в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую летнюю обвувь для продаж в летний сезон. За счет увеличения количества товара она сможет увеличить и свой доход. Имея прибыль побольше, Иванна сможет и домой приобрести необходимые вещи и в бизнес вложить нужные средства.
texts.en: Ivanna lives and works in Borislav. She has previously received financial help from Kiva that aided the development of her business and helped her to sell then purchased goods after earning a planned profit. Since receiving help from Kiva, Ivanna's children were also able to find work, which now provides significant help for the family's budget. This time, Ivanna needs a loan in the amount of 12 000 hryvnia to purchase women's summer shoes for resale during the summer season. She would be able to increase her income through increasing the quantity of merchandise. Having a higher profit, Ivanna would be able to purchase necessary things for her home and invest needed funds into her business.

loans.use: to purchase summer shoes

loans.name: Kantutas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de ritos tradicionales, venta de medicina natural, tejido de mantas, venta de conservas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio anteriormente hace seis años, al observar el negocio que tenía su tía, decide ingresar a la venta del mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group Kantuta De Los Andes, which will begin its twenty-second cycle at Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Los Andes, is composed of eight members, and is headed by Board President Mrs. Francisca. Various businesses are members of the community association, including neighborhood stores selling traditional rites services, natural medicine, blanket weaving, and preserved food.

The loan will benefit microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Francisca is a member. She has been with Pro Mujer for seventeen years following an invitation from a family member who is part of the institution. Today she has a business selling food, something she began six years ago after observing her aunt's business.
 
The loan will be to increase capital through the purchase of wholesale rice, pasta, and potato from the El Alto city markets and afterwards sell in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthcare offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, noodles and potatoes

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, de manera personal emprendió la venta de medicina natural y química, ya tiene 21 años de poseer esté negocio, con el tiempo ha recibido capacitaciones de laboratorios así brinda un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo hace de manera ambulante de pueblo en pueblo, ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes, actualmente le colabora su hijo mayor en las ventas, trabaja todos los días de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde. El Sr. Alfonso vive con su familia que está integrada por su esposa, sus hijos de 20, 19, 17 y 14 años de edad.
Utilizara el capital para comprar vitaminas, antibióticos, pomadas, analgésicos, capsulas para el estomago, etc., mantendrá un inventario bastecido para las necesidades que sus clientes tengan en su momento, otra parte será invertida en remodelar su vivienda con  la construcción de un corredor.
Su visión es continuar fortaleciendo el negocio y tener una mejor rentabilidad que le permita cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, apoyar a sus hijos a culminar una carrera universitaria y cancelar su deuda lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Alfonso started selling natural and chemical medicines on his own. He has been in this business for the past 21 years. Over time, he received training from the laboratories so that he could provide better service to his customers. Alfonso is a traveling merchant who goes from town to town. He has a good collection of customers. He currently works with his oldest son in making sales. Alfonso works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. He lives with his family, which consists of his wife and children (ages 20, 19, 17, and 14).

Alfonso will use this capital to buy vitamins, antibiotics, ointments, analgesics, stomach capsules, and other products so that he can maintain a sufficient inventory for meeting his customers’ needs at any moment. Part of the loan will be invested in renovations to his home, which include building a corridor.

His vision is to continue strengthening his business so that it will become more profitable. This will enable him to cover the basic needs of his family, to support his children with finishing their university degrees, and to repay his debt as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, ointments, analgesics, stomach capsules, and other products, as well as pay for renovations to his home.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, ella es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, habas, papa, trigo, quinua, kiwicha y otras cosas mas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Los Paccollos" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Zoraida lives in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, which is in southern Peru. She is a respectful and modest individual who engages in agriculture and livestock breeding. Zoraida has several plots of land where she grows barley, beans, potatoes, wheat, quinoa, amaranth, and other crops. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Paccollos”.

Zoraida is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. She appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for the support they have given and promises to repay the scheduled installments with great responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. 

Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Erlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from copra (dried coconut meat). Helen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Salome is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell. She has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a long-time teacher turned entrepreneur and she recently opened Emaginations, an after-school, K-5 education center where “thinking outside the box” becomes the norm. Unlike traditional teaching settings, where there is so much emphasis being placed on standardized test scores, Tina believes that all children have a gift and a talent. Her goal is to provide the right learning environment, so that children can work together and tap into their innate creativity to solve fun and educational challenges in hands-on projects. 

Tina has over 16 years of educational experiences working in urban, suburban and affluent school districts. She has effectively used her professional experiences to propel her students to higher levels of academic achievement, increasing standardized test scores by an average of 43%. In addition to transferring her passion for learning and teaching to her students, Tina has facilitated multiple district professional development workshops for internal and external district clients. She has served in supervisory positions as a grade level chairperson.  Tina has a unique rapport with students and staff and has been able to transfer her energy, enthusiasm, and passion to create programs and organizations for students, which led to the opening of an educational environment that gives students the opportunity to use their diverse academic backgrounds and showcase their individual gifts.

Her curriculum is nonconventional, and it seeks to nourish the skills that standard-driven public schools often neglect. Through Emaginations’ focus on teamwork, risk-taking, creativity and diversity, children gain self-confidence, begin to think critically and learn to love learning.

Emaginations is a place where a love of learning is projected to change the face of how all kids learn and create a movement within corporate recruitment and retention. Tina will use this loan to purchase classroom supplies and advertising.

	For more information, see her website: http://www.emaginations.org/

loans.use: to purchase classroom supplies and advertise.

loans.name: Jebaud Lestari Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed and the Jebaud Lestari group was able to repay their loan on time. In the journey of their businesses, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get a satisfactory result. Because they get a satisfactory result, some of the members of the group earned enough money to save. During this time, their activities are monitored by the Loan Officer for their achievements and they serve as an example for other farmers. 

Ni Kadek sold all of her piglets and earned enough profit after deducting other costs. With the profit, she can fullfill her family's daily needs and savings. She and all the members of the Jebaud Lestari Group send their greeting to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the price of feed is high, the Jebaud Lestari Group want a larger loan.  At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, one member wasn't able to attend the meeting because of illness. Each member gets 2.500.000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

Ni Kadek used the loan to buy three superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still uses the mixed feed. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she has enough savings for venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and quality feed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 39-year-old woman, living with her two children and spouse in the area of Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Lolita has been making savings for some time now in order to buy a new motorcycle to be used for her transportation business, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. Instead she now wants to buy new tires for her old motorcycle, but she still does not have enough money.

Therefore Lolita has requested a loan so that she can buy new tires, with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that her rider will drive the motorcycle with due care and earn sufficient income.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio has been growing and harvesting rice to sell in town, and he has had this business for many years. This is the primary source of income for his family. With his generated income, he was able to successfully repay his previous loan, which was also used for farming.

Vergilio has taken a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. He is planning to expand his farm, hoping it will flourish and enable him to improve the family's standard of living and save for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 26 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jovelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Krezza

texts.en:
Krezza is 24 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Krezza is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Krezza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

This is the same person as the previous loan; she got married a month ago.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old, married and has four children, all of whom attend school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business farming root-crops in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming root-crops for twelve years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and married with two children. With one of her children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Luzminda has a general store business in the Philippines. Luzminda requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luzminda has been in this business for 16 years and earns additional income from raising pigs. In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shree Renuka Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh - Nasalapur Group

texts.en:
Rajeshree (the lady standing with her hand raised in the picture) lives in Nasalapur, Raibag, Belgaum. She is married and has four children. Both of the girls are married; one son has completed an ITI (Industrial Training Institute) course, and the other son is studying in 9th grade. She and her husband work in agriculture fields as daily wage workers. 

Rajeshree has rented agriculture land, where she cultivates crops. As per the deal, she is supposed to share half of the harvest with the landowner and keep the rest. She usually sells the crop to make some profit. Her family earns 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. This income is hardly sufficient to manage the day-to-day expenses. Rajeshree is also finding it difficult to pay for her children’s education. Hence, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 INR for her children's education expenses.

Rajeshree is the leader of the self-help group (SHG) “Shree Renuka Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh”. The group consists of eleven enterprising women, but only ten members are taking out a loan. All of them work as laborers in the fields. They all hope to save an adequate amount for their future. The group is helped by a local NGO, Mashila Abhivrudhi Mattu Samrkshana Samsthe (MASS), which provides requisite knowledge, training and motivation to women so they can be independent and earning hands for their families.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her son

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge se dedica a la venta de dulces tienda a tienda, , actividad que inició desde el año 1994, cuando como ayudante de albañilería trabajó en muchas tiendas y logró observar un espacio comercial donde incursionar para genera mas ingresos, pues a todos los distribuídores tenian mucho éxito.  Esto fue hace 20 años y desde entonces sus ventas no se han detenido, trabajando de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde vendiendo productos alimeticios empacados y dulces a crédito y de contado, haciendole compras a sus mayoristas para obtener un mejor precio y poder hacer negociaciones efectivas con las tiendas, que son su principal objetivo.  Su meta es ampliar la línea de clientes y tener mas vendedores. En la actualidad está aplicando  aun credikiva primer finacimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará dulcería y productos alimenticios empacados, como chitos, papas, platanos, etc. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará porque aumentará su inventario e incrmentará su vida crediticia.
texts.en:
Jorge has a business selling candy to stores for resale. He has been doing this work since 1994.  He had been working as an assistant bricklayer in many different shops, and he found a commercial opportunity to generate more income, since all the distributors were having a lot of success.  This was 20 years ago, and since then his sales have not slowed down.   He works Monday through Friday from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening selling packaged foods and candies on order and on credit. He purchases his products at wholesale in order to obtain a better price and be able to conduct business effectively with the stores, which is his principal objective. 

His goal is to expand his customer base and have more stores to sell to. Currently he is seeking his first loan through Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to purchase candies and packaged foods such as chips, potatoes, bananas and other items. He will use this loan in order to improve his business by adding to his inventory and building his credit history.

loans.use: to purchase candies and packaged foods such as chips, potatoes, bananas and other items.

loans.name: Jaibhim Mahila Sangh Group

texts.en:
The self-help group (SHG) “Jaibhim Mahila Sangh” is made up of five diligent women who are starting their first loan cycle with Kiva. All the women are former Devadasis. 

Kamalavva (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the featured borrower of this group. The members of this group need loans for goat rearing, cloth business, house construction, and to improve cultivable land. They also are daily-wage workers in agriculture fields.

The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and would perform religious rituals. The realities of a Devadasi are extremely challenging, since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this lifelong decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

This loan will benefit entrepreneurs such as Kamalavva, a 42-year-old woman living in Kohali village, Athani, Belgaum. She is an illiterate woman because of her Devadasi background. Kamalavva is a very hardworking woman. She has her own cultivable land; she cultivates the crops and sells them at a reasonable rate in the market, and she uses some grains and vegetables for her household. She is a single mother living with her three children, who are studying in school. Kamalavva is earning around INR 4,500 per month.        
          
The loan Kamalavva is receiving now will be used to improve her cultivable land by renting a tractor. This will help her to increase her monthly income. She wants to use the additional profit for her children’s education and to change the standard of living of her family.  

All the group members are against the Devadasi system because as being a Devadasi, they experienced a lot of distress in their lives. They want to eradicate this unwanted system.

loans.use: to rent a tractor.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Шоира очень трудолюбивая, добросовестная, честная и ответственная женщина. Шоира жительница сельской местности. С юных лет Шоира занимается разведением скота. У Шоиры нет образования чтобы устроиться на работу и разведение скота является основным источником дохода для семьи. Муж Шоиры работает на стройке по сезону, все свободное время он помогает жене ухаживать за скотом. Шоира разводит и ухаживает за скотом, а ее муж продает и покупает этот скот на базаре. Шоира хочет дать своим детям достойное образование, чтобы в будущем они не знали нужды как их родители и стали отличными специалистами в своей профессии и приносили пользу своим родителям и стране. Шоира хочет взять кредит чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и увеличить прибыль. Шоира благодарна таким организациям как ООО МДО "АРВАНД" за предоставленную финансовую поддержку для жителей сельской местности и желает организации процветания и успехов в дальнейшем.
texts.en: Shoira is a 40 year-old woman. Shoira is a very hardworking, conscientious, honest and responsible woman. Shoira is a resident of a rural area. Since a young age, she has been involved in breeding livestock. She does not have an education to get employment, and breeding livestock serves as the primary source of income for her family. Shoira's husband works at a construction site during the season and helps his wife to care for the livestock during his free time. Shoira breeds and cares for livestock, and her husband sells and buys livestock at a market. Shoira wants to give her children a decent education so that they would not experience their parents' needs in the future and become excellent specialists in their fields, and benefit their parents and the country. Shoira wants to obtain this loan to increase livestock headcount and profit. Shoira is grateful to organizations such as MDO Arvand for the provided financial support for rural residents and wishes the organization prosperity and success in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Abdul Hameed is a 56-year-old married person. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two children. He is a shoemaker by profession and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for the last thirty years. He sews leather and rexine shoes by machine, and after that attaches the sole by hand stitching. In this way he gets income for his family. He has been making shoes at home. Now he wants to increase his business on a wide level but he does not have the amount to buy the initial raw material for making shoes.

Therefore, Abdul Hameed requested a loan so that he can buy the initial raw material for making shoes. This will help him to continue his business. He is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for shoemaking.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 36 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is the mother of three daughters and two sons, three of whom go to school. Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been cherished by her whole family for many years.

Nowadays, he wants to offer more dishes to his valuable customers so that he could grow his income.

Rukhsana is receiving a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to get more profit and savings as well.

Rukhsana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for cooking more dishes and then selling at the restaurant.  .

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a 58-year-old married woman. She is the mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health.

Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years and assisting his younger son by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Now her son has gotten a lot of experience about the affairs of general stores. He can easily deal and handle the store deals alone. He wants to offer more inventory which is more consumable in daily routines.

Tahira wants to grow the business of her son. This is the reason she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She has repeated loan cycles with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Afsha

texts.en:
Afsha is 39 years old and the mother of two children.

Her husband owns a firewood shop, in which he sells pieces of wood. He sells firewood mostly to the chefs who cook meals for ceremonies and events. He purchases wood and then cuts it into pieces by splitting it with an axe. In his area consumers have to face a lot of short fall problems with gas. This is the reason people like to use this firewood for cooking. Now the winter season is going to start and the demand for firewood as well. He wants to buy wood to cut into small pieces to sell.

Therefore, Afsha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to earn a maximum profit in this winter season.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce firewood for resale.

loans.name: Junaid Arif

texts.en: Junaid Arif is a 30-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of three children. He is a cold drink distributor by profession and very expert in his profession. He has been distributing cold drinks such as Pepsi, Coca Cola, Sprite, Team, etc. to the shop keepers of his town for four years. He takes orders and provides a supply of all demanded drinks. He deals with his regular customers with a professional attitude. That is why he has been running this drink distribution business smoothly. Due to his good deals, his customers trust him, so his income from this business is increasing. Spring season has started in Pakistan so demand for cold drinks has also increased. Therefore, Junaid Arif wants to enhance his business so that he would be able to fulfill the demands. He requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan amount he would be able to distribute more supply of cold drinks. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance his cold drink distribution business

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia aged, 38, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC Pakistan. She is an old member. She has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact her husband owns a cooking oil shop and sells kinds of local cooking oils. He wants to buy a large quantity of branded cooking oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome poverty.

Therefore, Safia has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy branded cooking oil in large quantities. She is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy branded cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur madame Khady, est âgé de 38 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la couture depuis des années. Elle vient solliciter un crédit afin d’acheter des variétés de tissus pour les confectionner en ensembles pour hommes et revendre. Khady possède un petit atelier de confection, paie la location et l’électricité. Quand elle a de la matière première, elle peut coudre jusqu’à trois ensembles par jour vendu 15 000F l’un. Avec le bénéfice, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Le projet que Khady veut réaliser un jour, est d’ouvrir un grand atelier, de l’équiper de machines, de chercher d’autres tailleurs et d’augmenter sa production.
texts.en:
Khady is 38 years old, married, and a mother of a family. She has been working as a seamstress for many years. She owns a small sewing workshop and pays for the location and electricity. 

Khady is seeking a loan in order to buy a variety of fabric so that she can make men's outfits to resell. When she has the fabric, she can cut up to three outfits each day and sell them each for 15,000 francs.

She will use her earnings to help support her family's everyday expenses.

One day, Khady dreams of opening a large shop, equipped with machines, where she will hire other tailors in order to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make men's outfits to resell

loans.name: Josué Isaac

texts.es:
Josué tiene 21 años de edad, es un joven muy emprendedor que ha estudiado bachillerato como nivel académico, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico, aún no tiene hijos y por lo tanto solo su pareja depende de él.

Josué trabaja en una tienda como vendedor, este trabajo lo hace desde hace un año, a este trabajo lo recomendó un amigo y fue así que logró un puesto en la tienda, pero Josué también trabaja en la agricultura esto lo hace con personas vecinas que él le paga  para que le ayuden al cultivo, esto lo hace con su padre durante la mañana.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar la semilla para sembrar, tres sacos de abono y el veneno para regarle en todo el tramo donde va a cultivar, esto le ayudara mucho ya que la milpa la preparara mucho y esperando en Dios que le de muchos ingresos la cosecha. 

Los sueños que tiene son poder seguir trabajando en la tienda y en un futuro tener una propia tienda para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Josue, 21, is a young entrepreneur who has a high school education.  He and his partner, who is a homemaker, have no children so she is the only one who is dependent on him.

Josue works as a salesman in a store, where he has been for a year.  A friend of his recommended him for the job.  Josue also works in agriculture and for neighbors who pay him to help with cultivation.  He does it with his father.

The loan he is requesting is to buy seeds to plant, three sacks of compost and weed killer for his cropland.  This will help with prepare the rows for planting.  He prays the harvest will give him a good income.

His goal is to continue working in the store and have his own some day so he can improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant, three sacks of compost and weed killer for his cropland.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
Doña Zoila tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, vive con tres de sus hijas y ocho nietos. Ella se dedica a realizar desayunos y almuerzos que le solicitan los trabajadores de la zona ya que la prefieren por lo bien que cocina, su esposo le ayuda a repartir lo que le solicitan de comida y se lleva unos demás para vender al que desee, cuando regresa ha logrado vender todos y trae una lista con más pedidos. Desea este crédito para comprar suficiente materia prima y cocinar toda la cantidad de comida que le solicitan ya que cada vez que prueban su comida, la clientela aumenta. Esta actividad le ayuda a ella desde hace muchos años para salir adelante con su familia ya que en la zona donde viven es muy difícil encontrar una fuente de empleo, por lo que ella se siente muy bien ya que sus ganancias aumentan y generan mensualmente para mejorar la condición económica familiar.
Eligió Fundación Mujer ya que cuenta con una baja tasa de interés y cuenta con una atención personalizada. En un futuro ella desea montar en el patio de su casa unas mesas y convertirlo en una soda donde las personas tengan un punto donde consumir sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 54, is married and lives with three of her daughters and eight grandchildren.  She works serving breakfast and lunch to workers in the area who like her cooking.  Her husband helps with delivery and also takes along extra food to sell.  After selling everything he returns home with a list of orders.

Zoila is requesting the loan to buy sufficient ingredients for the orders she receives.  Every time a customer tries her food her clientele increases.  This business has helped her for many years to get ahead with her family.  In the area where she lives it is very difficult to find employment, so she is happy that her monthly income is increasing and the family economy improving.

She chose the Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation) because of its low interest rate and personalized service.  In the future she wants to set up some tables in the patio of her house and turn it into a soda fountain where people can come and try her delicious food.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she makes.

loans.name: Cesar Rafael

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 31 años de edad, estudio noveno granado de educación básica, está soltero y vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos los cuales se dedican a la.

Cesar tiene como negocio principal la agricultura aunque también es transportista tiene un carro tipo pick up donde hace viajes  a las personas que lo buscan, pero la actividad  principal de él es la agricultura el cultivo de granos básicos  maíz, frijol y maicillo. Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad ya que no ha encontrado otro empleo, el trabajo está muy cerca su casa  lo que le facilita cuando es la época de acercar  los granos.  

El cliente necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz, frijol, maicillo y pagar a mozos. Esto le ayudara a tener los insumos a tiempo para cultivar y así tener la alimentación para colaborar con su familia .

Sus sueños son poder sembrar más de lo que hoy cultiva y así sacar mejores producciones de cultivos y tener mejores ingresos para hacer su casa pues piensa un día tener una esposa y familia y así prepararse desde ahora, el préstamo le ayudara a empezar a alcanzar su sueños  a  prosperar a través de la actividad que realiza que es la agricultura.
texts.en:
Cesar, 31, has a ninth grade education, is single and lives with his parents and three siblings who work in agriculture.

While Cesar's main business is agriculture, he also works in transportation using his pick up truck to drive people where they ask him to.  His main activity is growing basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum.  He decided on this activity because he could not find any other employment.  He works near his home which makes it easier to get there in grain growing season.

The borrower needs a loan to buy farm supplies to plant corn, beans and sorghum and to hire workers.  This way he will have the supplies in time to plant and grow food for his family.

His goal is to be able to plant more than he usually grows to increase production and have more income so he can build a house.  He wants a wife and family one day so he is preparing ahead of time.  The loan will allow him to meet his objectives and to prosper through agriculture.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to plant corn, beans and sorghum, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos farmaceuticos en el municipio donde habita. Su negocio nació de la experiencia de su cuñado, de quien aprendió para hacer real su sueño de producir de manera autonoma sus ingesos y resolver los gastos de su hogar. A su cuñado tambien le debe  el acceso a la zona de su influencia, pues se la dejó cuando decidió no continuar es esta actividad. Hoy Luis tiene 4 venededores, quienes venden a crédito y de contado , mientras él cobra semanalmente. En la actualidad está aplicando aun creikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos naturales pues rotan rapidamente y no tiene en existencia. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local comecial y tambien su propia casa, para aumentra el bienestar de su faqmilia.
texts.en:
Luis, 39, sells pharmaceutical products in the town where he lives.  His business stems from his experience with his brother-in-law who taught him to earn an income independently to cover his household expenses.  His brother-in-law passed along his customers to Luis when he discontinued his business.

Luis now has four salesmen who sell on both a credit and cash basis, and he is the one who collects payment weekly.  He is now applying for his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy natural products, which have a quick turnaround, since he has no stock left.  His goal for the future is to have a store and buy his own home to increase his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy and stock natural products, which have a quick turnaround.

loans.name: Las 3 Rosas De Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS 3 ROSAS DE SANTA ANA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Telesfora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, artesanía en mantas, venta de queso, servicio de construcción, venta de carne, trenzado de mantas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Telesfora es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche y queso; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, ya que ella desde niña ayudaba en la lechería a sus padres, cuando se casó decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente lo criará en su estancia para el proceso de lechería. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "LAS 3 ROSAS DE SANTA ANTA" communal bank is starting its second loan cycle through the Pro Mujer Program at the Copacabana Social Center.  The group is comprised of nine members and Telesfora is the president of the board of directors.  The different businesses that the members are involved in are: milk production, blanket weaving, cheese sales, construction services, meat sales and blanket braiding.

The loan will benefit small business owners such as Telesfora who joined Pro Mujer a year ago by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her house.  She currently has a business producing milk and cheese which is a family business.  She used to help her parents with their dairy production but when she married she decided to establish herself independently.
  
The loan Telesfora is requesting will increase her capital so she can buy livestock in neighboring villages, which she will raise to produce milk.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Deysi Yasmin

texts.es:
Deysi vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja como ayudante en un puesto de venta de frutas en el mercado de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poer salir adelante y poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos de su hogar.

Deysi esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá realizar una mejoras en la habitación donde vive, comprar algunos enseres y solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose por haber por hacer realidad su gran sueño de tener una vida digna, un negocio propio y apoyar a sus familiares”.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in the city of Chincha and works as an assistant for a fruit stall in her city's market. Through this work, she can have an income to allow her to get ahead in life and be able to support her family with the household expenses.

Deysi is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that she will be able to make a few improvements to her bedroom, buy a few appliances and repay a few personal expenses. In this manner she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue working hard to make her biggest dream a reality: that of having a decent standard of living, her own home and support her relatives.

loans.use: to improve her home and buy household appliances.

loans.name: Reyna Madelyn

texts.es:
Reyna de 18 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por motivos de que 6º grado no existía en la escuela de la comunidad y la madre no permitió dejarla estudiar, esta soltera y sin hijos y vive con su madre y dos hermanos. Desde hace dos años se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, aprendió sola el negocio y lo realiza en las comunidades cercanas donde vive, además hace viajes ya que la madre tiene un pick-up, el horario de trabajo es variado por lo general de 8am a 4pm. 

Necesita el crédito para invertir en ropa, comprara camisas de mujer, faldas, sabanas,  ropa interior y camisas de niña y vestido, y otra parte pagara una pequeña deuda de su madre. En un futuro desea tener un cafetín en la clínica de la comunidad, y espera seguir trabajando con su negocio y con las ganancias poder solventar la deuda contraída y poder invertir más en ropa.
texts.en:
Reyna, 18, studied up to the 5th grade and was unable to continue studying as there was no 6th grade in the community school and her mother did not allow her to continue studying. Reyna is single and has no children; she lives with her mother and two siblings. For the last two years, she has been working in clothes sales, she learned this trade on her own and she sells in the communities near to where she lives. She also makes a few journeys as her mother has a pick-up van. Her working day is varied, but in general is from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. 

Reyna needs the loan to invest in clothing: she will buy women's blouses, skirts, sheets, underwear and t-shirts for children and dresses. She will also use the loan to pay a small debt from her mother. In the future, she wants to have a cafeteria in the community's clinic and she hopes to continue working with her business and with the profits be able to repay the debt incurred and be able to invest more in clothes.

loans.use: to invest in clothes. She will buy women's blouses, skirts, sheets, underwear, t-shirts for children and dresses. She will also repay a small debt from her mother.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaias vive en la provincia de Pacuartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él compra ganados pequeños y los hace engordar para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias ganaderas del departamento del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal " Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un pequeño ganado. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Isaias lives in the province of Pacuartambo in the region of Cusco in southern Peru; he is a very respectful and kind person who works in agriculture and livestock. He buys small cows and fattens them up to then sell on in different livestock fairs in the department of Cusco. Isaias belongs to the "Intipaqareq II" communal bank and it is at this moment in time that he needs the loan to buy small cattle. 

He is grateful to all of the Kiva loan lenders for the help given and he pledges to meet the scheduled repayments with a great deal of responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy a small cattle.

loans.name: René

texts.es:
René de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos y solo dos viven con ellos, de los cuales uno trabaja y la última asiste al  kinder, además tiene a cargo una nieta que vive con él. El señor es agricultor en pequeño, desde su niñez se dedico al trabajo de campo, actualmente es el caporal de una hacienda a unos 3 kilómetros de su casa y se va en caballo, el horario de trabajo es desde muy de mañana al atardecer. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 2 novillas para en un futuro reproducirlas, porque el señor tiene conocimiento de cómo darle el cuido y la alimentación al ganado. En un futuro desea tener una pequeña ganadería para trabajar en lo propio y tener el negocio de comercializar ganado, para generar ganancias para  seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
René is 46 years old. He went to school through the 3rd grade. He is married and his spouse is a housewife. He has 5 children and only two live with them. Of these, one of them works and the  other is in kindergarden. He is also raising a granddaughter who lives with them. He is a small farmer. Since his childhood he has worked in the country. Now he is the foreman of a ranch that is 3 kilometers from his house and he gets there on horseback. His work schedule is from very early in the morning until dusk.  

The loan he is asking for is to buy 2 heifers so that he can breed them in the future. He is knowledgeable about how to care for and feed cattle. Iin the future, he wants to have a small cattle ranch to work as his own and have a business selling cattle so that he can generate income to keep supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 heifers to breed them in the future.

loans.name: José Navitidad

texts.es:
José tiene 61 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le colabora a en la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos están en casa de él.

José se dedica a la a agricultura, su padre le enseñó la siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo, entre otros, debido a su edad ya solo realiza el trabajo en el campo, lo más difícil para José es hacer llegar los insumos agrícolas hasta su casa pues vive en una zona muy apartada de la ciudad  y recorre 46 kilómetros para ir a comprarlos. Su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

El crédito él lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar el maíz, el maicillo, las hortalizas y las verduras, comprará abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas, semillas entre otros.

Sus sueños seguir apoyando a su familia, seguir trabajando para hacerlo ese ha sido el sueño de toda su vida
texts.en:
José is 61 years old. He went to school up to the second grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife and also helps with the farming. He has 5 children and of those only two of them live with him. 

José works in farming. His father taught him to plant corn, beans, sorghum, and more. Due to his age, he only does farm work. The most difficult thing for José is getting the agricultural materials to his house. He lives in an area that is very distant from the city and he has to go 46 kilometers to buy them. His work schedule is 6 hours a day.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural materials to plant corn, sorghum, vegetables and greens. He will buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds and more. His dream is to keep supporting his family, and to keep working to do it. This has been his dream his whole life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to plant corn, sorghum. vegetables and greens. He will buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, ha aumentada la calidad de sus prendas y entrega en menor tiempo los encargos de sus clientes, las circunstancias familiares han cambiado positivamente, esto se debe a que invirtió el financiamiento anterior en todo lo necesario para equipar su sastrería.
José está optando por un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos, botones, telas, agujas, tizas, alfileres y pagara la reparación de la máquina de coser, será de mucha utilidad para seguir progresando con su negocio.
texts.en:
José has increased the quality of his clothing and delivers orders to his customers in less time. His family circumstances have changed for the better. This is due to investing his previous loan in everything he needed to outfit his tailor shop. 

José has decided to take out another loan to buy thread, buttons, needles, chalk, pins, and to pay for the repair of the sewing machine. It will be very useful to keep progressing with his business.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, fabric, needles, chalk, pins, and to pay for the repair of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to prepare the soil, such as fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a kind 47-year-old married woman. She is the mother of a daughter and five sons. She is very hardworking and loves her family very much. 

Her husband is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He has been making headdresses and garlands for grooms. The headdresses are used by grooms and worn for a single day but the cost is high due to expensive decoration. There is a lot of demand for headdresses and garlands because the marriage season is at peak nowadays. He has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. 

He wants to buy get extra benefits through marriage season and wants to offer more headdresses of various designs. For this purpose he wants to buy more raw materials for making attractive headdresses to offer. 

This seasonal business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are also increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. 
Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making headdresses and garlands in order to get extra benefit. This is why Nazia wishes to obtain a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy materials for making fancy headdresses and garlands.  

He hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family. Nazia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy material for making headdresses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts for men and for women and underwear and to invest in her tortilla business.

loans.name: Beibi

texts.es:
Beibi vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es un joven con muchas ganas d eprogresar, por ello cada día se esfuerza mucho en su empleo como gestor de ventas y cobranzas, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder apoyar a su familia.

Beibi esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracais a su apoyo el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como calaminas, madera, clavos, entre otros para poder realiar mejoras en el techo de vivienda, ya que hay muchas lluvias y ello ha hecho que su vivienda se inunde en varias ocasiones,a si mejorar su calidad de vida y seguira luchando par poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”comprar un terrero y construir una mejor vivienda”.
texts.en:
Beibi lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is a young man with a great desire to advance.  In order to do so, every day he puts forth great effort in his job as manager of sales and collections.  With this he is able to have income in order to be able to get ahead and to be able to help his family.

Beibi is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their support, he will be able to buy construction materials like sheets of corrugated iron, wood, nails, and others.  He will do this in order to be able to make improvements to the roof of his house.  There is a lot of rain, and this has caused his house to flood on several occasions.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  He will continue struggling to be able to make his big dream a reality.  His dream is to buy a piece of land and to build a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Zenon Braulio

texts.es: Braulio vive en la provincia de Pacuartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que trabaja en una entidad publica en el area de administración, él pertenece al banco comunal " Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para educación de sus hijos. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en: Braulio lives in Pacuartambo province of Cusco department in the south of Peru.  He is a respected and simple person who works in the public sector in the area of administration.  He is a member of the communal bank "Intipaqareq II" and, at this time, needs a loan for personal use to pay for his children's education. He thanks all the investors for the help offered and promises to very responsibly and punctually make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: for his childrens' education.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, sigue haciendo uso de los créditos para mejorar la variedad de mercadería que ofrece en su negocio, en esta oportunidad el crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra vitaminas, reconstituyentes, capsulas para los riñones, jarabes, etc., se mantendrá trabajando por una larga temporada.
Con el préstamo anterior cancelo un lote de medicinas naturales que necesitaba para responder positivamente a las demandas de sus clientes, ha mejorado favorablemente su situación económica.
texts.en: María continues using loans to improve the variety of merchandise that she offers in her business. This time, she will invest the loan she is requesting by purchasing vitamins, revitalizing tonics, capsules for the kidneys, syrups, etc.; she will continue working for a long time.  With the previous loan, she paid off a batch of natural medicines that she needed to respond positively to customers' orders, she has favorably improved her economic situation.

loans.use: vitamins, revitalizing tonics, capsules for the kidneys, syrups, etc.

loans.name: Jacquelinne Antonieta

texts.es:
Jacquelinne, necesita capital con el que comprara vitaminas, jarabes, analgésicos, antibióticos, entre otro tipo de medicinas que sus clientes buscan, será de mucha ayuda para continuar trabajando.
Con el financiamiento anterior surtió de variedad de medicamentos su negocio, ha sido positiva esta acción porque actualmente cuenta con más clientes, mejoro sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Jacquelinne needs capital to purchase vitamins, syrups, analgesics, and antibiotics, among other types of medicines that her customers want.  It will be a great help in order to continue working.

With the previous loan, she stocked a variety of medicines for her business. It has been a positive action because she currently has more customers, and she increased her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, syrups, analgesics, and antibiotics, among other medicines

loans.name: M.asim

texts.en:
M.asim is a 30-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a medicine distributor and very expert in his profession. He has been distributing all types of medicines to the medical stores of his city for a few years. He takes orders and provides supply of all demanded medicines. He speaks with a monotonous tone that is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his regular clients. That is the reason his number of regular clients increases day by day. So he wants to expand his business of medicines supply. He deals with his regular customers with a professional attitude. That is why he has been running this medicine distribution business smoothly. 

M.asim wants to enhance his business so that he would be able to fulfill the demand. He requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan amount, he would be able to distribute more supply of medicines to medical stores. He is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine for distribution.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 34-year-old married woman. She is taking a loan for her husband’s auto rickshaw’s repair. 

He has been driving the auto rickshaw for providing transportation services to the passengers. He likes to drive at night time because at night the passengers pay more than daytime. 

A few weeks ago, her husband was casually driving the rickshaw at night time. Due to darkness his rickshaw crashed into barriers and its body was seriously damaged. Now the passengers cannot sit in the rickshaw because its body and seats are in disarray.

Therefore, Sultana has requested a loan so that her husband can repair the rickshaw and seats so that he can drive it smoothly again. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband.

Sultana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw.

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia is a 29-year-old married woman, living along with her spouse and child in the area of Lahore.
 
She has been doing embroidery through machine at home for the past several years to support her family. In fact, her husband is also doing the same work at home, but he earns an insufficient income to support family, so she helps her husband in his tasks related to the embroidery. 

She sells embroidery dresses in her town. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery through machine and wants more materials for embroidery so that she can cope with the increasing demand for her arts.
 
She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.
Sadia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 60-year-old married woman. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 
She is receiving a loan for her son; he owns an iron shop in which he sells binding iron for making roofs. Due to an increase in the cost of iron, he is unable to buy new inventory to sell from his shop. 

This is the reason, Sughran has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy binding iron to continue his business. 

Sughran hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for her family. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy binding iron for reselling.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children.
 
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Afshan has contacted with Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, to buy one wheel and to pay the labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Afshan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and  field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan Carlos es un señor de 57 años que habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida y procreó su familia.
Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a laborar como Guarda de seguridad donde día a día arriesga su vida por el tipo de trabajo que desempeña por ganarse el pan de cada día y llevarlo a su humilde familia.
Don Juan Carlos además de tener su trabajo ha hecho un gran esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los préstamos que ha obtenido de los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le puso una pequeña pulpería a su esposa para ayudarse en los gastos del hogar, ya que su salario es muy bajo y apenas alcanza para la alimentación.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para gastos médicos como para comprar de medicamentos, realización de exámenes y pago de consultas médicas, ya que se ha sentido mal de salud y no quiere faltar en su trabajo porque necesita mucho de su salario para sobrevivir.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas sigan apoyando al más necesitado.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, a 57-year-old man who lives in the municipality of El Sauce, where he has lived his whole live and where he made his family.

For more than ten years, he has worked as a security guard where day by day he risks his life for the type of work that he does in order to earn the daily bread and bring it to his humble family.

Juan Carlos, in addition to having his job, has made great efforts and with the help of loans that he has gotten from Kiva investors through Ceprodel, he set up a small grocery store for his wife in order to help with the household costs, since his salary is very low and barely pays for food.

At this time, he needs a loan to pay for medical costs such as purchasing medicines, and paying for tests and medical appointments, since he has been feeling poorly and doesn't want to miss work because he really needs his salary to survive.

He hopes, and trusts in God, that these people will continue helping the most needy.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, and pay for tests and medical appointments

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 36-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children and equally responsible for all of them. 
She belongs to a very poor family, and this is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his activities. 

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories such as doors, windows, tables, etc. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. 

Due to an increase in iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business. To fulfill the demands of his customers and to run his enterprise efficiently, he needs some capital to buy iron rods and welding material. Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy iron rods to carry on his business.
 
Yasmeen is very glad and thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron rods to carry on her husband's business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia vive en el distrito de san juan de Lurigancho, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja desde hace 4 años como cocinera en un sauna de su distrito, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Sofia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a asu apoyo ella podrá comprar un estante pata poder exhibir los productos que prepara y también solventar algunos gastos personales, ello le permitirá tener un mejor orden para trabajar, asi podrá vender más platillos en su trabajo y poder seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su restaurante propio”.
texts.en:
Sofia lives in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho.  She is a woman with great desire to get ahead, and for this she has worked for the past four years as a cook in a sauna in her district, from which she can have income in order to get ahead.

Sofia is thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase a set of shelves in order to show the products she makes and also to pay off some personal expenses. This will allow her to have better order in her work space, so she can sell more meals in her work and to be able to continue fighting to realize her greatest dream: to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a set of shelves and to pay off some personal expenses

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 33, is a married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. 

Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband; he is the single source of income.
 
Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to fix, paint and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents over rickshaws' bodies and paints them for renewal. Mostly he paints whole bodies of rickshaws for renewal. 

He wants to buy damaged rickshaws for renewal and then reselling. In this way he can easily generate maximum profit after renewal, but he does not have enough cash in hand.
 
Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy damaged rickshaws for renewal and selling.
 
Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy damaged rickshaws for repairing and then selling.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She would be in her first loan cycle with Kiva and BRAC Pakistan as well.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Afshan's Group

texts.en:
Afshan, who is 42-years-old, is married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchases goats, billy goats, bull calves, heifers and so on from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock, which is very tough for him in his old age. He is doing effort and earning money for the survival of both of them. 

He wants to buy billy goats to sell on the Eid-ul-Azha because many people like to buy billy goats to immolate on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable, but he does not have enough savings to buy billy goats.

Therefore, Afshan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy billy goats to sell. He could earn maximum profit to pass their lives with peace and calm.

Afshan is very pleased after receiving this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy billy goats to resell

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Guido con su anterior crédito, ´pues con él pudo comprar cobre y chatarra, con el que  pudo aumentar los inventarios de su negocio, sus ventas y con ello su estilo de vida. En la actualidad estpá aplicano a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará nuevamente cobre y chatarra para incrmentar sus inventarios y así mismo sus ventas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Guido with his previous loan; with it, he was able to purchase copper and scrap metal. This enabled him to expand his business's inventory and his sales, and thus, his standard of living.

He is currently applying for a new loan with which he will purchase copper and scrap metal again, in order to expand his inventory, and thus, his sales.

loans.use: to purchase copper and scrap metal

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
