Entre risas y saltos, se acercan los niños al puesto de frutas y golosinas de Gloria, lugar donde encuentran su merienda preferida, los niños siempre se van contentos por la calidad de los productos y la excelente atención que reciben. Ella tiene la edad de 48 años, está soltera y tiene un hijo mayor, quién es su mano derecha. Inició el negocio hace 25 años, comercializaba frutas en canasto en diferentes mercados, hasta lograr establecerse en un punto fijo. Ahora, un pequeño tramo es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar frutas, tales como mango, bananos, jocote, papaya, entre otros; asimismo golosinas. Gloria deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, con el que espera aumentar su clientela de manera que incrementen sus ingresos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Es una mujer soñadora y con visión de futuro, una de metas es hacer crecer el negocio, un lugar más amplio en el que pueda brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With laughter and jumping, the children come up to Gloria's fruit and candy stand, a place where they find their favorite snack. The children always leave contented with the quality of the products and the excellent service they get. She is 48 years old, single, and has an adult child, who is her right hand man. She began her business 25 years ago, selling fruit in baskets in various markets, until she managed to establish a fixed location. Now her little spot is her primary source of income.

She asks for this loan to increase her production of capital. She needs to purchase fruit, such as mango, banana, jocote, and papaya among others, and also candies. Gloria places her confidence in the loan, with which she hopes to expand her customer base in order to increase her income and be able to improve her family's quality of life. She is a woman full of dreams and with a vision for the future. One of her goals is to grow her business, to have a larger place in which she can offer better customer service.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as mango, banana, jocote, and payapa among others, and also candies.

loans.name: Lucila Santos

texts.es:
Lucila esta acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos y todos están acompañados, solamente ella y su pareja viven en casa. Desde hace 20 años tiene un molino en casa, además tiene un negocio de pupusas, los dos negocios los realiza en su vivienda y el horario de funcionamiento del molino es de 7am a 12pm y las pupusas al fin de semana de 4pm a 8pm. 

Necesita del crédito para comprar la tolva del molino,  ya que el que esta en uso se ha deteriorado y necesita una nueva para darle un buen servicio a los clientes. Ella planea seguir trabajando los dos negocios y que vayan en aumento para generar mas ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de pupusas, ya sea en la compra de mesas y sillas para la comodidad de los clientes.
texts.en:
Lucila has a partner who is a farmer.  They have 3 children and all have partners; only she and her partner live at home. For the past 20 years, she has had a mill at home, in addition to having a pupusa business. She runs the two businesses from her home, and the mill runs from 7am to 12pm and the pupusas on the weekends from 4pm to 8pm.

She needs the loan to purchase a new hopper for the mill, since the one that is in use has deteriorated and she needs a new one in order to provide good service for the customers. She plans to continue working in both businesses and hopes that they increase to produce more profits and to continue investing in the pupusa business such as purchasing tables and chairs for the comfort of the customers.

loans.use: to purchase a hopper for her mill.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and her husband is a blacksmith, manufacturing iron accessories, doors, and windows which are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories as well.

A few days ago his welding plant has broken down due to overheating and needs to be replaced with new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband will be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  

Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 24-year-old lady living with her spouse and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she could provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw from several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his family. He has to do maintenance on the motorbike and the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand. Therefore, Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can maintain the moto rickshaw. She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories, doors and windows used in houses. He also provides door-to-door services to weld  broken accessories.

A few days ago his welding tool overheated and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding tool and additional iron accessories but he does not have cash in hand due to a lot of household expenses.
 
Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a new welding tool and additional iron accessories for manufacturing.  

Farzana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new welding tool and additional iron accessories for manufacturing.

loans.name: José Leocadio

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, estudio tercer grado, en el tiempo que fue a la escuela requería muchísimo sacrificio estudiar, por la mentalidad de sus padres que decían que de letras nadie se mantenía, ya que le decían que era mejor trabajar que la escuela, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa, los hijos ms grandes le apoyan con los trabajos, que realizan, mientras que los más pequeños van a la escuela. 

Él es agricultor, de la edad de cuatro años su padre lo indujo al buen camino de ser una persona de bien y productiva. En la zona que vive es totalmente agrícola, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz y maicillo, también tiene ganado, ordeña dos vacas las que le ayudan a tener la leche y cuajada, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de la casa por lo que no necesita un medio de transporte para ir a su trabajo, la actividad la realiza en compañía de sus hermanos, el horario de trabajo lo realiza de 5:00 AM a 12:00 MD.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una yunta de novillos para poder trabajar con ellos en la agricultura, el préstamo le servirá para realizar la actividad productiva que desea hacer.


Sueña con poder tener primero lo más necesario para su familia,  que sus hijos aprendan el buen ejemplo y que tengan una forma mejor para ganarse la vida trabajando, por eso está dispuesto a apoyar a sus hijo para que estudien.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old.  He went to school until the third grade. At the time that he went to school, studying required great sacrifice due to his parents' mentality, who said that no one survives by writing. So, they told him it was better to work than go to school.  He has a partner, and she takes care of the household tasks. The older children help him with the chores that they do, while the younger ones go to school.

He is a farmer, and since the age of four, his father encouraged him on the good road to be a good and productive person. The area where he lives is completely agricultural, and he works growing corn, rice, and sorghum. He also has cattle, he milks two cows that helps him have milk and curd. His work is near his home, so he doesn't need any means of transportation to get to work. He works with his brothers, and their work schedule is from 5:00 until 12:00 midday.

He needs the loan to purchase a team of steer to be able to work with them in the farm; the loan will allow him to achieve the productivity that he wants to have.

He dreams first of being able to have the basic necessities for his family, and that his children learn the good examples and that they have a better way of earning a living in work and, because of this, he is ready to help his children so that they go to school.

loans.use: to purchase a team of steer to be able to work with them in agriculture

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a widow and a mother of five children living in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has encountered many difficulties in her life; a few to mention are: the death of her family members and husband, inadequate finances to properly manage her business, and thieves that broke into her house and stole her bike.
 
With the new loan, that she has requested, Mariana will buy chicks, piglet feed, medicine for piglets and chicks and part will be used to repair her pig fence. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long time. She has regular customers who buy from her.  Her business is situated at a good site, which acts as a means to advertise her products.  Secondly, the waste from pigs and fowls will be used as manure to increase harvest.  With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of food for consumption and the distance travelling to the market will be reduced. 

With the profit from this loan, Mariana will take care of her children, provide for their medication and education and will also build her house. To her GHAPE loans are preferable because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and members are also trained on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy chicks, medicine, piglet feed and fence repairs.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 50 and the mother of four children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase all products from his General Store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone he has built up very good relations among his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and this is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 
Therefore, Bilqees has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way and this will help him to cope with the demand. She thanks to Kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventry for general store

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, aged 50, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles and clothing. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Rasheedan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount. 

Rasheedan is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has started a clothing business and wants to support her family through her business. Sughran purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. 

Presently, she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to lack of money, Sughran is facing a problem. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva and their partner BRAC Pakistan. Sughran is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.

Ghazala has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy toys and some plastics items for resale. In fact she has been selling seasonal items on a stall in the market. She sometime sells food items like fried potato chips and samosas on the stall. But now she has decided to add toys for children and some plastic personal products for resale. In this way she will be able to earn more income to support her family.

Ghazala seems very happy after receiving this loan; she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more items like toys and plastic items for her stall.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat is 42 and the mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Asmat requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Asmat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. for her general store

loans.name: Tariq Mehmood

texts.en:
Tariq Mehmood is a 41-year-old, married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with his family. He is the father of three sons and two daughters. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calf for one or two years until they have grown up and are healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. He also trades buffaloes as well. He buys buffaloes at a low price and sells them to the people at a profit.

He has been producing milk and breeding from his buffaloes. His production of milk and his breeding procedure have been effected because he is unable to cope with the demand. 

Tariq Mehmood wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income constant but he has already invested all his savings into the expenses of his dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue his business smoothly.  Therefore, Tariq Mehmood requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to purchase a new buffalo for his business.  He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business as well.

He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have the working capital to improve his business selling wallets.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María, ha mejorado su situación familiar y financiera gracias a la inversión del crédito anterior, pues surtió de mercadería necesaria para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y brindar un buen servicio.
Como una forma de continuar fortaleciendo la tienda de manera inmediata opta por un nuevo crédito que le ayudara para comprar huevos, harina, aceite, dulces, boquitas, jugos, gaseosas, pan, galletas, jabón, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
María has improved her situation both in financially and for the family thanks to the investment of the previous loan. Through that loan she was able to stock the goods she needed to meet her customer's requirements and provide a good service.
.
As a manner of continuing to strengthen the store in an immediate manner, she has chosen to apply for a new loan to buy eggs, flour, oil, sweets, snacks, fruit juice, fizzy drinks, bread, biscuits, soap, washing detergent and bulk grains.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, oil, sweets, snacks, fruit juice, fizzy drinks, bread, biscuits, soap washing detergent and bulk grains.

loans.name: María Nely Milagro

texts.es:
María tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven en casa y los demás ya formaron sus propios hogares.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, ayuda a su esposo desde que están juntos pues es la forma con la cual han  sacado adelante a su familia la cliente también tiene otra actividad económica la cual es la venta de queso y leche pues ellos también tienen ganado lo que les permite de ahí sacar leche y sus derivados, pero la actividad a la que más se dedica es la agricultura, la distancia del trabajo del cliente es 1 kilómetro,  los cuales recorre a pie en carreta y en ocasiones en carro  el horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

Invertirá el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas, fertilizante, abonos, semillas entre otros propios de la agricultura esto le ayudara a tener a tiempo el dinero para cultivar y así asegurar la alimentación para su familia.

Sus sueños son tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando la agricultura, poner un puesto de venta en su ciudad, para su familia desea que sus hijas sigan estudiando y que saque una carrera universitaria para que trabajen y se superen.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old, she is married and her partner works as a farmer. She has 4 children of which only two live at home and the others have already got their own homes.

María makes her living in agriculture, she has been helping her husband since they have been together and this is the manner with which they have been able to get the family ahead. María also has another financial activity: selling cheese and milk, as they have cattle which will enable them to obtain milk and its derivatives. However, the activity in which María spends most of her time is agriculture. María's workplace is at one kilometer away, which she covers on foot, in a cart and sometimes by bus. She works 6 hours a day.

She will invest the loan to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizer, manure, seeds and other items for agriculture which will help her to have the money she needs on time to cultivate the crop and therein ensure that her family has food.

María dreams consist in having the opportunity to continue working in agriculture and setting up a stall in her city. In terms of her family, María dreams that her daughters can continue studying and that they can obtain a university degree to work and better themselves.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizers and pesticides) and to pay for manual labor, because her uncle is going to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 35 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of the amount of use it regularly gets. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Parveen is so thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 32 and the mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 
Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. Therefore, Kiran has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more stock of fresh vegetables on daily basis.
She is thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Hafeezan's Group

texts.en: Hafeezan is 50 and the mother of four children living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. His relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his is business running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Hafeezan requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Hafeezan hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way in that the loan will help him to cope with the demand. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventry for general store

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is 30 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them in his shop. He has been selling gent's shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies' shoes as well to meet customer demand, but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount. Therefore, Ghulam Fatima requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy attractive ladies' shoes as well. 

Ghulam Fatima is very happy after taking this loan and says thank to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of shoes for resale

loans.name: Amber

texts.en: Amber is 35 years old and married. She is the mother of five children. She has started a clothing business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. As the spring season has started in Pakistan, she is in need of seasonal clothing for resale. However due to a lack of finances she is facing a problem. Therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she will be able to purchase more clothing for resale. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing for resale

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is the age of 41. She is the mother of three children. Kaneez lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd and butter for sale. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. Kaneez's husband is in need of a buffalo to increase his income through his milk sales business so Kaneez requested a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale business.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 38-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan along with his family. He is the father of three sons and two daughters. He owns a chicken sales shop in the market. He has been running his chicken shop for the last 10 years. Shahid buys chickens from the wholesaler and sells them in his shop to the customers. His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his clients. Shahid is the sole earner of his family, so he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family's requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. 

Shahid wants to buy broilers to sell at his chicken shop to improve his living standard. For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So he made contact to BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for his chicken sale shop. Shahid is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for his chicken sales shop.
